text: This place is super clean (major bonus points!) and they have great vegetarian pho.  I am mostly restaurant vegetarian and it's hard to find pho that is not either a beef or chicken broth.  Their's (I think called tofu/vegetable) is very flavorful, salty, and comes with a platter of very fresh veggies to arrange in your soup as you like.  My husband and I each get a large bowl- it is huge and takes forever to eat!  Their fresh spring rolls (the cold ones) are good, but not the best i've had.  The sweet sauce that comes with them is great.  Major bonus points for a place that offers a veg pho on par with the traditional beef one!

There are a lot of pho restaurants in this town. This one is my favorite for 3 reasons. 

Reason #1 - It's got the word "pho" in the name, so you know it's good.

Reason #2 - They are from "Saigon", where pho was invented, so you know they know what they are doing here.

Reason #3 - The number "8" is a very humbling number to give ones self. It's better then 5 and not as douchey as 10.  So you know they've got class.

Yup, the humblest, most authenticest, phoiest restaurant on Eastern. Much better than Pho Saigon 7 and less pretentious then Pho Saigon 9.  

Till next Tuesday Pho Saigon 8, when my parents will pay for my dinner again!!

Best pho on this side of town.  Not as good as the Spring Mountain location, but a really good substitute when you can't make it across town.  Egg rolls are the bomb, chicken bun is one of my faves, and the #31 is my go to dish!

Biggest drawback is the service is kind of slow.  Food comes out pretty quick but sometimes it can be a wait to get drinks and/or the check.

The service is mediocre and the pho is not bad . The meat in the pho was tough and hard to chew . My lil one ordered the BBQ chicken and it was delivered to us In a matter of minutes after ordering . After cutting into the chicken I realized that the chicken had been cooked earlier in the day or yesterday perhaps ( def not fresh) and reheated once we ordered . I asked the Waiter bout this and he informed me that " we cook the chicken half way and finish the cooking when ordered, otherwise it would take 30 min or so to cook". Now I know it doesn't take more then 5-7 min to cook a thin slice of chicken . The chicken is a direct reflection of how they run their kitchen . I've been eating vietnamese for a long time and I will never return to this place . The prices are a lil above the avg. for this food.

Absolutely love this place. We always come here to get our pho fix & the staff here is great. They see that we have a toddler and automatically come out w/ our waters & of course a styrofoam cup w/ a lid on it w/o even having to ask them for it. 

Typically we like to share our pho w/ my son rather than ordering him his own bowl. So we'll ask for an extra bowl and along w/ the extra bowl we asked for, they bring out scissors (to cut the noodles and the meat) and plastic silverware. I love the fact that they knew and we didn't have to ask for every single thing. Never disappointed and their food is delicious!!

Our usual order is,
#1 crispy fried egg roll
#20, noodle with rare eye round, flank & beef ball

if i could give 0 stars i would ! caterpillars in my soup?? so gross ! even when we told them they said bugs are in the vegetables, no discount, still payed full price for soup that had bugs ?? never coming back

I am giving a one star for bad experience with the staff and not the food. Happened to be there during lunch from work and decided to experiment with seafood and shrimp pho(#43). The food when it came to the table smelled completely off and rotten that even turned a few heads from neighboring tables. On complaining to the server about the foul taste and requesting to change the dish, they blatantly refused. I told them that I had not tried the dish, and the smell told the entire story. They refused a refund or change to a different dish, and had me reorder a second dish and pay for both.

This is one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant considering I eat out at least once a day. They have probably lost more than one customer today as the friends who were with me were baffled at this as well and have decided not to go back to the place.

Horrible horrible place the service was the absolute worst. They're were plenty of staff but not sure what their problem with.  I had to ask for refills napkins. I asked for children chopsticks,  a staff member literally took rubber bands and dropped in the table. Didn't even attempt to make them for me. The service was slow and rude. Never again will I be back. They're are better pho places in this town with betrer service and food. I was extremely disappointed

Absolutely love their food here. I try to stop here each time I come into town. I Have tried many different options on the menu but, I keep going back to their beef pho. Service isn't the greatest, they take your order bring your drink and most times you don't get a refill unless you wave someone down. But the food makes up for it.

Been going here for years and the food has been consistently good and service adequate with a few exceptions but I am moved to report today my pitiful experience. Fried egg rolls and beef pho the former came out small and burnt the latter didn't come at all. I ate the egg rolls and thought oh well but I was basically ignored while the wait staff entertained themselves. Decided to leave after 25 min. And I was one of only a handful of customers, not like they were busy you know.honestly the place has been in decline for some time now. Come on guys straighten up.

It was better when they opened, but now I'd rather drive the half hour to get service.   The food quality varies on time of day or time that you show up.  As the day draws to a close, the broth resembles water and salt thrown in a bowl with oil.

But as the others said, service is in the pits.  Once we were seated and they completely forgot to take our order for like 15 minutes-then we left.  Be sure to order two drinks and water for yourself, because once they throw you food  on your table they'll never check up on you.   

Also the tables are cramped so close together so if you and the person scoot your seats together, you'd practically be siamese twins.
If you are not eating here and live on the south end of town then you are cheating yourself out of one of life's best pleasures.

Joseph and I live in PS8's area and forever opted to make the drive to Chinatown instead.  I suggested we try our neighborhood pho joint so we could make a quick trip for dinner or takeaway.  Broth, he says, was pleasingly flavorful and almost as good as Pho Vietnam's {on it's good day}.
The phò is so good! The decor and feel of the restaurant was nice too. Servers were friendly. It was a nice experience for my first time here :)

Rude ass mother fuckers here, if you like being treated like shit then you'll want to come here. Tried asking waitress questions about menu because it had been my first time & she acted like I was wasting her time. As well I ordered an ice tea, & never got it. Then they tried to bill me for that! The food isn't all that great either. I'm very upset with the way I was treated. They all need attitude checks. Litterarly felt like just because I was white they were rude as hell

I was first introduced to Pho Saigon 8 from a friend who took me to the one in Chinatown, so I was really excited when this place opened on my side of town. 

I usually get the grilled sliced pork & fried egg rolls over vermicelli and vegetables, and my husband usually gets the grilled lemongrass sliced beef over vermicelli and vegetables or the chicken pho, and we get spring rolls to share. 

Service is good when we dine in, although we usually do take-out more often. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the place is very clean.

Wow Pho Saigon 8,  I am so disappointed in you guys.  How much cheaper can you get?  You raised your prices from 5.75 for a bowl of pho to now almost 9 dollars... and you still don't have enough to buy noodles and veggies?  This is the cheapest spring roll I have ever eaten!  There are maybe 5 strings of rice noodles in it, and nothing except chopped lettuce.... no other meat except shrimp that has been half cut.  I'm sorry but I have been a regular customer for several years and have seen it get worse and worse...  you have lost a customer.  Everyone,  don't expect quality anymore from this place.  Smh.... I am disappointed... and sad at the same time that quality of food has gone down the drain.....

I love pho and all sorts of soups in general. I usually order the hot soy milk, #14 pho, spring rolls or regular fried egg rolls. It all taste yummy as just like the first original location on Spring mountain in China town. Unfortunately, I'm a shame to same I still constantly come here bcos it is the closest pho restaurant near me (I live in Henderson). They have the worst service. Every time I come here, they either give me water after my food, or they never refill my water. When my family and I order other drinks or smoothies, it takes so long to come out. Like, it comes out after we are done eating and we just take the drinks to go. Also, I always ask for extra lime and sauté. 19 out of 20 times, they forget. Not to mention, these mistakes happen whether it is slow or busy. 

If u want good service, don't come here.

My wife and I were craving bun and our normal place Pho Mai Lan was closed for the evening. So we decided to go for it and give this place a shot.. Well.... It sure was a mistake! We walked in and they asked us how many. We told them two, and they walked us over to a table set down two glasses of water and walked away. Came back a minute later and set down two menus with our napkins on top, then walked away again. After about 5 minutes they come back over and ask us what we wanted. We hadn't decided just yet and we asked for another minute and the reply was, "Okay, just yell for me when your ready." And then she walked away. 
Okay?! By now they've lost any chance at a tip.
So after we decided to get #'s 69 and 70 we looked around and they came over took our order and about 10 minutes later our food came out! It looked good! Well!.... It wasn't. It was a HUGE disappointment! The shrimp on both plates were dry like last weeks left overs that they nuked for a minute and tossed in our dish. Our pork was a little on the burn side and had a funk nasty after taste, but it wasn't terrible enough to not eat... And my roll was fairly uncomfortable to eat. We'd have to say the worst part was the fish sauce. That wasn't to great. 
So while we ate the atmosphere wasn't very inviting. The wait staff was talking on their phones while they were on speaker so we could hear all of their conversation. It was also not very welcoming when they would look at us hoping we would leave. 
All in all everything was terrible except their pricing was pretty fair.

I used to love this place but two years ago they started consistently majorly skimping out on the meat for the pho. The eggrolls are delicious, crispy, and one of the best in Vegas though. I saw a waitress in the bathroom and she didn't wash her hands when she left! Service is typical for a pho place.

Me and my friend coming from California when in this restaurant. We liked the food but horrible service!!!! The owner may put attention in the service .i ll not to invite friends anymore to go there was so embarrassed.

Good authentic Vietnamese food. They get busy so order ahead for pick up. I get the pho dac biet and the pork chop with rice. So yummy! Egg rolls are good too. I come back often and would recommend this place to anyone.

Worst costumer service I've ever had. So rude. I can't believe people come here. I was afraid to ask for anything and when I finally did they walked away like they didn't hear me. Never coming back. The food was good but not worth the experience of being treated like that.

My husband walked in and was seated immediately, which was pretty fast on a friday during lunch hour and it didn't take them long to take our order. 

My husband usually gets the pho with rare streak only and I like to get the Hu Tieu - dry with the cellophane noodles. So far so good but once we got our food it was a different story. 

Hubby's order was fine but mines came with soup. Not dry BUT with soup! 

So I made a complaint to our waiter (the only older man with glasses) and he said that I DID NOT order dry noodles. And I told him I did, my husband even heard my order. The waiter also said he can not change my order because I "didn't order it right". And basically blaming me because I didn't order it right. Ok fine, whatever I'll just eat it so he'll be quiet. I' m not the type to start any confict. I took the first bite and wasn't happy it wasn't the dry version. It tastes totally different and I didn't bother eating it again. 

Just when were about to leave to pay our bill, the waiter comes back and noticed i did not eat it and he offered to change my food. Seriously ? What happen to "I can't change your order?" 

Anyways, I wanted to see the manager after this but they supposedly don't have a manager. So I just told the lady who managed our bill what happened and she apologized for his service. She knew who I was complaining about and I didn't even have to point out who it was. She also offered to take my order off the bill and all we had to pay was for my husband's pho. So thank you for that. 

That is why today I gave it 3 stars if it wasn't for the lady upfront who helped us. It'll definitely be awhile before my husband and I come back here.
My girl and I love their Pho. The service can be a little slow at times, but the food is awesome. We're regulars.
I'm not a big fan of pho, but this place really impressed me. Usually, I order the #55, and my boyfriend gets one of the soups. We eat here often.
Food is good, wouldn't say bad service except nobody seemed to speak English so come knowing what you want.
The serving of food is amazing and the customer devices is great, always a great place for lunch or dinner- always leave with a doggie bag

This was my first time trying pho or Vietnamese food but it was delicious. I got pork broth pho with rice noodles and grilled pork and chicken. I think it was #47. I also had their spring rolls, which were amazing. 

The only problem, one which makes me hesitant to return, was that I ended up sick the next day. Now, admittedly this could be a coincidence; but I can't recommend 5 stars when I ended up sick for 2 days.

5 stars for the food. But -2 stars for service and -1 star for their weird prices. 

Food is good. I mean, typical pho and viet food with nothing nasty in it. So 5 stars for that. 

Service...haha get ready. Ordered drinks and food. Our food comes out first so I'm waiting for our drinks. 5 mins go by..nothing. So I asked the waiter (the really fat one) and he gives this irritates look on his face and says "IT'S COMING!" well alright jeez. People normally get their drinks before their foods, fatso. ESP with pho...all that MSG, you need a drink with it! The others weren't really any better. We went around 9pm and I guess they were closing soon. Felt like they were trying to rush everyone out. Well hello! You're in Vegas! You expect people to have early dinner times? Whatever. The only reason we tipped is because we had a kid with us and she made a mess with her rice -__-

Their prices are so weird! 6.05 7.05 8.05 dude seriously? You are so stingy you have to do .05. I guess that .05 really helps the owner out but seriously? I've never seen more ridiculous prices. This place is already way more expensive than many other pho places. And having that .05 on the menu just makes em look more stingy.

The entire menu is numbered. I ordered #43 which was a pork broth bowl with fresh streamed lump crab meat and shrimp which was DELISH. Everything comes out with fresh mint, basil, bean sprouts, limes carrots and jalapeños.  I went a step further and ordered shrimp spring rolls and lettuce wrapped egg rolls to complete my feast. The overall experience was absolutely amazing. I would highly recommend checking this place out.
My favorite pho place. Egg rolls are amazing and my soup is always on point. My favorite place to go out to eat hands down.
All I can say is DELICIOUS! From their Pho, to the fried rice, to their rice plates.  Everything is just delicious.  If you don't believe me, see for yourself.

First off I think the food is good. This is my go-to place when I want to have some pho around the area. My only concern is that the guy named Tran gave a really bad customer service. I mean that guy is not fit to be a server with the kind of attitude that he has. He's just flat out rude. He even rolled his eyes when we asked for straws and to go container. Who does that? With that being said, it just drives the customers away and think not to come back.. Not good for your business.
Food is great. Always come here with the wife. Service is quick and they are always nice.
I've only been once, it was good pho, pretty cheap, and reasonably fast. I wouldn't say it was anything spectacular but worth it if you're in the mood.

My friends and I had broth that was sooooo salty. And this was our second time coming here.  The waiter brought out an order wrong and blamed it on my entire group. We were completely baffled as to why this waiter was blaming us.  We just wanted to get the what we ordered. 

Extremely rude service. I rather go down the street to lemon grass.  The waiters are nice and the soup taste cleaner and not pumped up with MSG.

Went here because Lemongrass Cafe was closed for remodeling... that place is our go-to, but my partner and I were really craving pho, so we reluctantly had to settle for another nearby place.

Been here once before, but wasn't much memorable back then. Felt the same way the second time around. We were immediately given menus and water, which was cool. Took a little while for someone to take our order though, but no biggie.

Lots of different meat options for the pho. But felt that the broth itself was almost flavorless. Perhaps because it was a freshly cooked batch and didn't have enough time to steep? Who knows. But the side of herbs of basil, sprouts, lime, and jalapenos were very fresh though.  Spring rolls were also big and plump and a filling appetizer for two people. Just wish it had been cut in half to make it easier to eat.

Service wasn't exactly warm, but adequate. Waters were refilled without having to ask. No one checked in on us at the end though or dropped off a check, so we just paid at the counter. (Not sure what the normal protocol was). 

Fills the craving, but just made us miss our usual Lemongrass Cafe.

Noodle soup gets 5 stars...can't find a better place, good meat portion, fresh sprouts.
Appetizer gets 4 stars...#6 is fantastic, especially the dipping sauce.
Customer service gets 2 star only because they bring the food out...
 
Customer service can use a lot of improvement, especially when the owner's son (the chubby one) is working. The rest of the staff reflects his attitude.

Used to be my favorite pho in the area

But recently,  the chicken pho is more like been sprout pho with the essence of chicken

They reduced the amount of noodles and meet SUBSTANTIALLY

Will have to try some other places

The spring rolls are good, though
Best Pho place in Henderson but they raised their price.  Their bbq meat is very well marinated and delicious.  3 stars for being too expensive and we had to keep asking for water.

We have been going here for years and the amount of meat and food we get, gets smaller and smaller. Not sure what's going on here but the last 3 visits we had were poor. I used to love going here but for the price it is not worth it. I even called to ask them why so much as changed and they didn't understand what I was saying.

**CREDIT CARD FRAUD!***        CREDIT CARD FRAUD!

I am warning you to avoid this place completely.  I.D theft and credit card fraud is on the rise.  Don't let this happen to you.  

Here's what happened.  My good friend paid for the lunch with his credit card.  This was the only transaction for the day on that specific card.  That evening he went to use it for dinner and the card was already shut down.  Come to find out, there were 4 transactions totaling about $800 originating from North Las Vegas while this restaurant is in Henderson (can't be at two places at the same time).  Praise the Lord that the credit card company caught the red flag and canceled his card and the investigation is pending.

I'm so bummed that this happened.  The food is great, the price is not bad and my wife and I were beginning to love  this place!  But in all seriousness and gravity, the good food is not worth the risk of having your identity and credit card stolen.  Be warned and be wise.  I care about all of you, who are reading this, and wouldn't want you to experience such a crime against you.  I implore you to stay away!

Have fun on your quest for good eats!
Sincerely,
Eric F.


p.s the Sunrise Cafe is great... it's on the north side of the same plaza a couple doors down from starbucks.

Pho Saigon 8 is my favorite Vietnamese place in Vegas. Although I prefer the West side one on Spring Mountain because it allows a bit easier access with my wheelchair, I am glad that they are now present on the Eastside. A previous Yelper commented that the Lemongrass Cafe across the street is much better, but I have to disagree. Furthmore, the danky carpet in the other place ruins my appetite. Saigon 8 creates the best both for the phos everytime. According to a lot of my Vietnamese friends, it is created fresh every day. The summer rolls are always delicious and their peanut sauce is superb. When I need comfort food this is the place to be. I even feel guilty if I do not order my usual dishes.

Pho never fails at this location. Service is quick and prompt, although not very personable (but I don't set high expectations for that). Once ordered that pork chop with rice dish...it was really good although the portion was a bit small for the price. It was cut pretty thin and they only give you one slice. But other than that, the pho is better than most and it's usually our go to pho spot.

Pho Saigon 8:
Eastern and 215 Location (Eastern and Pebble)

Let's start with the constructive criticism.  It's smaller places, parking is a little tight otherwise you are parking in the LVAC parking lot.

And most of the servers might have a little trouble speaking English but not all and the owner is usually on-site and very fluent.

Now for the more important stuff, good food, and great price.  I've noticed you seem to get a little more for your buck here than I've seen at other viet restaurants and the food always comes out quick.

Spring mountain location:
Same as above for food, good food for the price, parking is worse though if you go when it's busy but seating is much better and it's larger to accomodate groups. 

Extra info:
I guess the things I'm not crazy about but they aren't unique to either location is if you want to substitute something it's a huge no no, at best you can just have things removed.  And I think the soup only comes in a mainstream size, maybe not quite large but you can't order a small but some dishes come with a small size of Pho minus the meat.

Came here for a quick Pho fix. It was a decent place easy location to find. The inside is clean looking , the tables are too close together. The staff was not the friendliest either.
The food: was okay. The pho was decent but it was missing something the flavor was not there. They had a piece of tendon in there literally bigger then my debit card. We also had the vietnames rice noodles with shrimp and pork. For some reason they gave us that to go. So I believe this took away from the experience of how its to be eaten. The egg roll was not cut instead whole which is not how I've seen this plate served. The flavor was a bit bland the shrimp were over cooked.
I have been here twice.  The service is quick, the food is cheap and tasty, but both times I ate here it made me sick.  Too bad :(

We stopped here on our drive out of Vegas, and it was a great surprise. I ordered the pork and egg roll with noodles, and loved it. The price was great, too. Family of four ate for less than $30 - a steal in Vegas.

I am constantly trying to find something that is closer to Henderson thank Pho Kim Long to satisfy my craving for Pho. This place did it for me. Thank god. Pho was great! Fresh, satisfying, and service was good. Even when we order to go, everything is packaged properly and ready fast. Happy Customer and will be back often!
Amazing and crave-worthy... wanna blow their minds? Be caucasian and order #8... you're welcome.

Not the best Pho place at all! I definitely would choose one in China town before this. But the food is decent, so if you don't want to deal with long lines or traffic it's okay. But personally I would rather deal with that and get great Pho at Pho Kim Long. This place also is not clean or nice at all! Pho Kim Longs IS the BEST Pho in town. Trust me, your mind will be blown if you think this place is & then go to Pho Kim Long.

I guess I made a wrong choice today. 

If you can't make the food right, then shouldnt you only focus on what you are good at? Dont make a menu with 100 of choices and none of them taste good. (We ordered 5 differents food on the menu and all of them have weird taste)
The service are amazingly awful. No greeting, no smiling, no customer interaction, Nothing. 
I paid not only for the food but also the service. If your foods aren't good enough. Make it up by the service.

I've been coming here for a few years now but it's my first time reviewing it. If you're on a time crunch this place is great. I often come here for lunch. The price is unbelievably affordable and you get great tasting food. The service is average, they're very quick. You're able to order and get your food very quickly. We ordered spring rolls for appetizer, that's a must. Healthy, refreshing and yummy. I had the Combination Crispy Chow Fun, it was edible. I will not be ordering this dish here because they have so many dishes that taste better. My sister in law order the crepe, yummy yummy. The Pho is magnificent here, once you try it you'll be addicted. If you like coffee you must order their ice French roasted coffee with condensed milk, there's nothing like it in this world. If I have to pick one cuisine to eat for the rest of my life it'll definitely be Vietnamese. You'll love this place.

Ordered take out over the phone... The girl taking my order was a bit sassy! When I arrived at restaurant she was sitting at cashier station... She did NOT greet me when I walked in! She told me the total, I handed her my credit card... then she asked "if I happened to have cash"!  WTF!!??? If I had cash don't you think I would have given cash??!! Duh!! Well at least she thanked me as I was leaving. 

Food was good so that's why I gave 3 stars! Too bad cashier was sassy & not friendly!!

I really like this place, I eat there 3 times a week. The food is much better than Lemongrass, the broth for Pho is better too. Only complaint I have is the servers don't fill your water often enough, you have to ask sometimes.

Overall it's a decent pho restaurant in Henderson. The staff is quick and pretty accommodating to certain requests. I believe they do automatically add gratuity of parties 6 or more,  which is fine... In the past, I have ordered pho, hu tieu, bánh canh, egg rolls, and bun bo hue...This is a variety that I normally don't order at other pho restaurants. Typically I just order pho with rare steak, tripe and tendon (which is pretty ok here)...so this just means Im giving this place a chance to outshine the typically mentality I have of pho restaurants. And gladly I did!! Yes, I would come back to try other dishes on their menu....

This was my first time ordering take-out from a Pho restaurant, so it was a bit confusing. I would only recommend they explain, or have on their site, or even have a sign explaining why it is served the way it's served.  The #11 was very good.

Pho Saigon 8 is definitely our favorite Pho place off Eastern near the 215, but I know there has to be better out there. The broth is just OK, not salty/flavorful enough in my opinion. The amount of meat they put in each serving varies from visit to visit. The french bread is good, not great. Sometimes it seems extremely fresh and flaky, other times it seems old.
Service is fast which should be standard at a pho place. Waiters are generally nice and quick to give refills or additional items. Overall, this is better than a few other Vegas places but I've definitely had better pho in other cities.
the pho and soup is delicious, the place is nice and average size, the pho I always order is perfect, the soup tastes good, the noodles are the best part and the employees are very nice and quiet
This is my favorite place for pho thai. Staff is very friendly and serves quickly. Take out available and is packaged nicely.

I would have to say one of the best places to get Pho. I get the #11 mostly.  It's soo yummy. I would have to say the service isn't the best, but the last couple of times I have been here its getting better.
Pretty good. They give a lot of meat with the Pho, which is rare in my opinion but always appreciated.

Waited in line. They seated a couple that came after us. Even though my wife reminded him that we were next. The waiter acknowledged we were next and still took the next person in line. That's bs. And it doesn't make sense he put them on a 4 seat table when 2 seat table was available. He then acknowledged he made a mistake and wanted us to wait another 5 mins. 

We eat here twice a month not anymore. There is a lot of places we can spend my money. 

Next stop lemongrass cafe 3 mins away.
Our family's new spot for Vietnamese food.
I asked two different employees & they told me that they do use msg!!!  their food taste fantastic but be aware if you do not want msg.
Looking at it as food only it was great. As a whole I felt like they didn't want my business. Maybe next time I will show up with an Asian friend. But yes the food was great.

Food is priced well and tastes fresh. Staff waits to be told to do things rather than being proactive. For example: clearing plates bringing menus and refilling drinks. They are friendly and efficient otherwise.
Its alright. Quality of food is good. Taste is rather bland. Pho is a bit on the oily side.

The pho served here is quick and tasty. It satisfies the nightly pho cravings and is a good place for those who live in the Henderson area, as it nearby. But there are better pho places in Vegas, if you are willing to drive.
First time to this place and was impressed. Super fast service and food was amazing can't wait to eat hear again.
Craving pho like crazy, glad I found this spot semi close to the crib past 9pm. Me and my man both ordered vegetarian bowls and they are  Hard to find good pho places that have vegetable broth too.

This is by far my favorite lunch place.  I love the soup - no matter what I have, it's always good!  It's a great comfort food, especially when the weather gets cold or rainy or if I'm feeling under the weather.  I start everything with an order of spring rolls, best shared with a friend.  So fresh!  Then order whatever soup that fancies me that day.  Make sure to order a SMALL because the LARGE is enough to share!  If I have room after eating all of that, I love to get a hot vietnamese coffee with that yummy cream.   So good!
2 stars because the Pho was really great but the service left so much to be desired that we will never eat here again.
This was the first time I've ever had pho, I had number 46 with egg noddles. It was so good!! I ordered to go and service was fast and friendly. Would come back again soon.

I usually get one of their Pho noodle bowls.  I like the beef brisket, tendon, and also the beef stew noodles.  Meat is always very tender and soup is very flavorful.  I also like the spring rolls with the lettuce and cilantro wrap.  Sevice is a bit lacking, after the food arrives the next time they see you is payment on the check.  Last week went in and notice the prices have gone up across the board.  I guess a business can do that if they are busy all the time.

We always have super fast and great service! The pho is amazing! As well as the chicken. This is the type of restaurant where they sit you down, take your order serve you and that's it. Some people like when they come back a lot of times, but I hate that. 
The number 11 pho is my favorite. It doesn't have too much to it, just one type of meat. 
All in all, I think it's great!

I just moved here from LA and I wasn't sure where to go eat and I found this place and the food was delicious. In LA we have tons of these restaurants everywhere. Here I only found a few and I have to say I ate at two different places and this one is the bomb!

I gave it 4 Stars because of the price of the bowl. I was there last Friday with 3 friends and we all ordered Pho. I ordered the #21 large with extra meatballs. It cost me $11.00. That's about $3-4 more than the other pho restaurants in Chinatown and it's much better in Chinatown. Okay, it was in Henderson but make it competitive. The meatball suck. It wasn't even good. 2 balls cut in half for $2.00 more? Wasn't worth the extra. They should have a combination bowl with everything in it. The broth was very good, egg rolls were good, and the spring rolls were good. I won't go back. I'm disappointed because they only had holson sauce, Sarachia sauce and a red chili sauce.
One of the worst 10 Vietnam Restaurant I have been to so far. The service here is terrible.  NOT COMING BACK. Gave this place 2 chances.

This is my second time here. The Pho isn't bad, however I've had better. I was disappointed in that I couldn't order the combination of meats I prefer like most pho places. Like most of these restaurants they do not give military or student discounts.

I want to first say that I really like the food here, but the service is less than mediocre.  And I know this isn't Joel Robuchon at the MGM, where the bussers scrape your bread crumbs off the table with a special bread crumb brush. But for heaven sakes, you are in the hospitality industry as well! I really don't feel their hospitality here! At least ask me if I would like some water? And even when you do ask me if I want water, it is as if you are angry for me coming into the place and having to actually make you work for your dollar! Or why do I have to flag you down whenever I need something? 

As far as food, the spring rolls were decent, but nothing to honestly to rave about. The pho was not memorable, but I have had so much pho, maybe I don't know a good one anymore?  They have no sandwiches also .

The décor is maybe the best thing that they have going for them, and location.  I really dislike their tables though. I am 5'1 and very small, and I still think their tables are small! The problem is that the tables have this poorly placed bar under them where my husband kept pushing my legs.  Each table is so closely placed. I can almost hear every conversation around me. Not much of a place for a first date. 

I love pho, but if there is another pho place at least a mile away from this one... I would choose the other, cause this place can really piss me off. They can be just darn rude here.

Stopped by here with LiLy D to grab a quick bite. 

We were in a rush so I just got pho tai. The waiter doesn't come by to check to see if I'm ready to order. He doesn't come by to check to see how everything is. They charge $1.50 for tea...wtf?

Thanks for picking up the check LiLy!
Good pho. I save a trip going to Spring Mountain when I was living in Silverado Ranch area.

One of the cooks went into the bathroom. And while I was washing my hand; the cook had gotten done doing her business. And I was expecting her to wash her hands. But no, this bishhh ended up leaving the bathroom with her unwashed hands. I also notice a few servers do the same. I am calling the Health Department soon!
The rare eye of round beef pho is the best I've had anywhere. It really is what makes the not-so-friendly, barely-there service tolerable.

so I got this place mixed up with Pho Little Saigon. I did originally rant a rave about how great this place was but it was not the right place. my bad, sorry for the confusion. However, I did have the pleasure of stopping into this establishment after my work out at the las vegas athletic club (same parking lot). I ordered the seafood pho and this place does it a bit different with the items of meat in the pho. They give you tiny eggs so i'm wondering if its maybe quail eggs? I don't know if they do this in all their pho dishes or if it is just in the seafood one, but one of the eggs seems to be a bit off so I don't know if it was bad or what. The broth is strangely sour if you taste it on its own.  its a clear yellow color which is not beef broth like its supposed to be. After adding all veggies, noodles, and meat it does take some of the sourness away but the broth is not authentic. Its lacking in the proper pho spices/flavor. it really was just a sour/salty broth. definitely not a traditional authentic Pho broth at all. in my opinion you are much better off going to the Pho Little Saigon in the chuck e cheese/99 cent store/in and out parking lot on the other side of the 2-15 to get the real deal, you will be much happier. Its where I always go when I am to lazy to make my own traditional Vietnamese food at home. Don't even waste your time at Pho Mai lan, its a rip off very expensive for what you get and its not authentic either, their beef broth is literally beef broth with no Pho spice flavor. $10 for a bowl of Pho is just ridiculous especially if its not the real deal!!!

This is hands down my favorite pho spot in town and I recommend it to everyone and anyone. The broth is packed with flavor and clean not oily , all of the veggies are fresh and crisp. Everything is very clean and fast-paced.  I'm a very picky eater and have a hard time most places when it comes to getting my order right but never once have they messed up my order... I even order to go confidently knowing they won't screw things up. The service is very fast for such a busy place and they're polite to my standards they make sure your cup is filled and like most Vietnamese restaurants are trying to get you fed and taken care of not make small talk to butter you up for a big tip (which I think many people are not used to and see it as bad service instead of doing a good job and efficiency ) which I find genuine and worth a bigger tip. If you do ever order to go make sure to ask for any extra sauce you may want because you only get what you order.

I don't know why this place only has 3 stars!?  The broth of the pho was de-lish!!
The restaurant was very clean.  The service was fast and friendly.  I will definitely be back pho more!!

The pho here is amazing! Service isn't too great but in all honesty the food makes up for it.  This place has the best crispy spring rolls, they're fresh and absolutely delicious.  The food here is very authentic, which is another reason the service doesn't bother me that much.  No one is rude here or mean.  They're just constantly busy, which makes sense for a tiny place that's constantly busy. As long as you have time the food is worth it here and incredibly affordable.  Definitely a place to try if you're on this side of town. :)

Excellent service, delicious and fast service. Love the Pho, hot tea and recommend visiting it at least once a week! (Lol) I recommend this place for dinner or lunch, intimate setting with a clean atmosphere. Here's a picture of my food... #29, Vegetable Pho with tofu

Clean, no wait, fast food, large portions, good pho, no-English-no-nonsense. Exactly what you'd want the morning after a night filled with regrettable actions. Pretty window blinds (though I don't think that contributes to the ratings). Now if I could just locate Pho Saigon 1, Pho Saigon 2, Pho Saigon 3, Pho Saigon 4, Pho Saigon 5, Pho Saigon 6, and Pho Saigon 7...

If I could give ZERO stars, I would. I've been to this restaurant in several times of hopes it would improve but now it just reached a new low. The chicken and beef frequently taste like rubber and are hard to chew. And today, I found a dead insect in my vegetable soup!!!! Absolutely disgusting! How dare you serve food to people and allow them to eat the nasty shit that happens to "appear". I will never be eating here again. Please beware, everyone.

It is very good and always packed ! The broth is amazing ! Service is sometimes a little jumbled as there are multiple people trying to help you !!takes forever to get your check and end up just walking to the register ! 

They have a great selection of Pho ! Apps are good but been to other places and they are better !!

It was empty when i entered which was odd because its right next to LV Athletic on easter. But it soon filled up. I ordered Rare Beef Pho and Spring Rolls and a Vietnamese Coffee all were on poi t and the pork in the spring roll wasnt gamey so i thoroughly enjoyed the whole meal. The staff is cool and they all pitch in to help which meant i wasnt waiting long for anything. The food got to the table lightning fast. Good place recommend it

We were trying this place for the first time. Not only did we ever get asked what we wanted to drink but I found a caterpillar in the lettuce that came with the egg rolls. Luckily we had just started eating when I noticed it. We were so grossed out we couldn't eat anymore. We told the waiter and all he said was oh sorry about that and walked away. We ended up leaving the place. The manager told us I won't charge you for the egg rolls but we still had to pay for the pho which we hardly touched..not going back there again.

The pho here is very good, not 5-star excellent, but very good. 

My usual go-to when out and about is Pho Kim Long but my office is located very close to Pho Saigon 8, so as a captive audience it certainly satisfies when craving pho for lunch. 

The service definitely leaves a lot to be desired in that no dialog is created (at least the times I have been here) and "friendly" isn't an adjective I would use to describe the employees.

That said, I'm not here to make friends, I want to eat soupl. And Pho Saigon 8 provides piping hot, delicious pho in less than 2 mins of putting in your order.

AWESOME pho.  The hubby had the dry rice noodle dish and his was excellent as well.  The spring rolls were good but I could tell they didn't make it to order.  Anybody who likes spring rolls know that it has to be made WHEN the customer orders or it it's just not as good!

Ridiculous. I order a vermicelli half beef half pork. They said they couldn't do half beef and half pork for  an order so I requested that I pay extra for the other side of meat. The owner refused and say they were not willing to do it either I got pork vermicelli or beef vermicelli. They were not willing to accommodate me!!! When I was willing to pay extra. Horrible customer service and horrible accommodation for people that just want to have a meal and willing to pay extra for food that is not included in the original menu item. I was not trying to get comped or get free food I was trying to pay for what I wanted. It is ridiculous that this is the only place that does not do half beef half pork when all of the pho Vietnamese restaurants do it. Extremely ridiculous. The sever was rude and not welcoming at all. Will not be returning here ever again. Some restaurants need to realize that there is plenty of competition and other places are willing to not only have better food but better customer service. We live in Las Vegas, our industry is service, experience.... learn something from other places!
Been here a couple of times very good I like the broth here better than some other places its beefier tasting

Their food is delicious, however their customer service could use a little bit of work. We waited about 15 minutes to have someone take our order and only had our waters refilled once without having to ask someone to help us. 
Even so, we will continue to eat here because the food is great and we love the environment!

I think this Pho restaurant is just fine overall. Perhaps I never had an issue with the service here, or perhaps I know not to really expect much in terms of service in small culturally unique joints such as this one. I also think the language barrier plays a role in the type of service you receive.   The service was ok, no one was rude nor made us feel rushed while we, two of the most indecisive people in the world, reviewed the menu. The Pho was good enough to warrant a return visit when I am not feeling like driving too far from my house for a bowl of pho. They provide all of the necessary standards such as the condiments (I love me some siracha!) and a heaping plate full of additions such as fresh herbs, sprouts and lime to add as needed.  I think Pho Little Saigon across the street and this joint are almost identical in service and in quality. My review is more of a 3.5 star but I will round it up as I am feeling generous.

I usually get pho here because it close to where I live and it's pretty decent. I get the chicken pho and my fiance usually gets their rare steak Pho--both are pretty good and I like their fresh spring rolls. The pho is good because the broth is flavorful enough and I feel there is a good balance of the meats and the vegetables. Can't say that I like their vermicelli dishes though, based off the shrimp vermicelli dish I got. The shrimp was poorly cooked (dry) and there wasn't enough vegetables in the mix to balance everything out. 

I've been told by my Vietnamese friends that this place is some what "Americanized." I guess I can see that....Oh and did I mention, at one point I was mortified to order from here because of their grade 'C'  rating? Yeah...I hope I didn't catch some food borne illness during that period...
Line was long and they are not organized took long for them to serve I've been going here for 4 years they need a bigger restaurant! Food is great but terrible service

I'm pretty obsessed with the Pho (beef) here. Thai tea is brewed near perfect and the Boba is always an added bonus. 

The broth was clear,  and has a great flavor. I ALWAYS take a few spoons of broth and sip it before adding anything. I even have my kids doing it. You have to be able to taste it for what it is. If the broth can stand the taste test alone, then you known the bowl is worth the cost.  The plate full of basil, bean sprouts, lemon and jalapeños was plentiful, and super fresh. 

My first time there, there was three of us. It was near lightening speed from when they took our pho orders to when the kitchen staff came out and delivered it to our tables. Seriously, I don't think even 3 minutes passed. Yay, for fast service!

The wait staff and cashier are bit lacking,  which is unfortunate. I asked the waiter for to-go bowls and waited far too long. Finally had to ask cashier, when son went to pay.

Our second trip,  the food and drink was just as good as the first time.  However, the lightening speed was gone, and actually felt we waited a longer time than normal. I will say it was packed on Sunday, so I understand.

All in all I love the Pho. I'm obsessed. I think about it all the time. If it weren't for Lent, I would be slurping it down right this very moment instead of writing this review.

This is the only place I go to eat pho in town, it is so authentic and delicious. Getting great food for such an affordable price in an authentic venue is probably what makes this my favorite pho restaurant.

Absolutely the worst customer service I have ever had. Actually I wouldn't even call it customer service. From the minute we walked in the atmosphere was unfriendly and uninviting. People that came after us were helped first. They never took our drink order and right before we ordered our food we almost walked out. We should have... Because it only got worse. Once we ordered our food and it arrived we were never asked if everything was ok or if we needed anything else. It looked like all of the employees had a frown on their faces the entire time we were there. Their lucky I paid and I definitely didn't leave a tip which I have never done in my life. The food was descent and with horrible customer service I would NEVER GO BACK. This place needs some customer service training, good luck.
The food is always great and comes out quickly.   Crispy eggrolls and pork vermicelli bowl are some faves.   Service is polite and never pushy.   Great place for a delicious lunch!

First off let me say that I rarely write one star reviews (check my other reviews on different restaurants) but I had to write this because of the HORRIBlE service that we received today! We ordered on the phone and they don't repeat your order back to you but when they get your order wrong, they claim that it's your fault. I am honestly not a difficult customer by any means but this place lacks any sort of customer service. We placed a simple order on the phone and repeated it to the lady multiple times. 

When my bf arrived to pick up the order, the order was wrong. Instead of 59 it was 69 that they gave. The lady said, "this is what you got, what do you want? An add on?" And he was trying to explain that the order was wrong. They started raising their voices at him basically blaming him for their mistake. So they get him the correct order and the order looked half of what is normally served. They clearly were annoyed and didn't care. They're lucky that he already paid and tipped before noticing the error because they did not deserve the tip. 

I completely understand that mistakes can happen but blaming the customer and raising their voices because THEY misunderstood is terrible business ethic. If they simply acknowledged their mistake and corrected it appropriately then all would be fine. This is not how to run a restaurant or any business for that matter. What a shame because I have family, friends, and co-workers that love pho but I would not recommend coming here to any of my friends and family any longer due to the terrible service. I'd recommend going to a different pho place, there's a ton in Vegas anyway.

Unfortunately, I'm not a fan of pho, so I hope this review proves to be useful for those who are like me, and would rather eat something else at Vietnamese restaurants.  This place is closer to me than Chinatown, so that's a plus for me.  My favorite dish is #71, the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio, a.k.a. grilled sliced pork and fried egg rolls over vermicelli noodles and vegetables.  The pork has great flavor, almost a sweet taste to it, and I love the combination of pieces of pork and eggroll, noodle, and peanuts in one chopstick-ful (as opposed to spoonful).  Delicious and cheap!  

It can get pretty busy during both lunch and dinner, so the service leaves much to be desired during those times.  Also, the parking lot is shared with various other popular establishments, so it can be hard to find a close parking spot during peak times. 

My experience with takeout orders has been positive as well.  The orders are packed well and the time estimates are pretty accurate.

Very very good pho broth! I get the special with everything on it! Their fried rice is good as well however it's on the stickier side . I often order to go, they are very fast! So far best pho broth I've had here in Vegas!

Pho' Saigon 8 is such a pleasantly wonderful surprise for me! My son and his beautiful girlfriend brought me here for lunch over Labor weekend. I have been back 3 more times this week with friends!!

The soups are a rice noodle base with almost unlimited combo's, seriously! (Maybe 50 different combo's!) portion are great, the small is not small and the large could possibly feed a family of 4! Jk

Absolutely love this place!! Get the today!! This is a great, fresh soup meal! You will be full on their soup, yes, on soup!
I am local, been there multiple times and never disappointed. The portions are big with lots of meet, service is very good for this type of restaurant. Price is also reasonable. Parking is plentiful.

The food is fabulous......always hot, fresh, and super yummy! The service is kind of slow and hard to get refills on drinks but otherwise its great....I don't mind the mediocre service in exchange for delicious food.

If you really like pho and enjoy the atmosphere and quality of a good pho then this is the place to go. The staff is always doing something to better the experience which is great and the service is quick as well probably my favorite place to eat pho within las veg

I've only been here one time, but I didn't have a single issue that a lot of the other reviewers harped about. I was promptly seated and had my order taken. I went with a standard Phó dish, a combination beef bowl, and was thoroughly satisfied with it. The prices, contrary to what some people are saying, were also completely fair... Especially for Vegas. I plan on eating here again!

Served me cilantro, twice. I was very clear about my allergy to cilantro and could very well have ended up in the ER getting a shot. But because of my husbands good eyes the crisis was avoided. 

Were they apologetic? No. 

Remorseful? No. 

Did they do anything to compensate? Only after pitching a fit was my meal comped. (which by the second send back I told them not to bother making again). Seriously?!? You want to charge me for a meal I sent back twice and did not eat a bite of? Bye!
I have been eating here for the last year. This is a great pho place. They have great service and the pho is delicious. I eat here 3 times a week and i would recommend the number #11.

My favorite pho place so far. They do it correctly, you can get tendon and tripe (my measure of authenticity), and they always have plenty of lime and basil. I like the spring rolls, you gotta add Sriracha to the peanut sauce tho. They only have like 3 smoothie flavors but avocado is one of them, so none of the other favors matter, and they also have Thai tea for when you don't want to drink avocado (which is rare). I can't give it 5 stars bc it's not the best *ever* but it's definitely the best I've found in the Henderson area.
Great Pho! Actually hot like it's supposed to be (not like other local places where the beef doesn't even cook).

My husband and I are always willing to try new places! 

We were greeted by a guy who sat us right away. Our waitress came by and brought us waters to start. Being first timers, we asked our waitress her favorites on the menu. She was so helpful, nice and patient with us as we decided on our order. Our food came out quick, hot and tasty. Our drinks were refilled in a timely manner and our waitress checked on us a couple times to make sure we were satisfied and liked our food.

The least friendly person in the whole place was the cashier. He didn't say anything to us except to tell us our total. He didn't even offer me my receipt, I had to ask him for it.... probably not a big deal to most people, but I expected the great service until I walked out the door. 

We'll definitely go back to try other things.

I come from the Bay Area in Northern California, so I was surrounded by so many Vietnamese restaurants growing up and I absolutely love the Vietnamese cuisine. So, since I've moved to Vegas, I've been in the search for my regular Vietnamese spot for whenever I'm craving pho or a vermicelli dish. 

Food:
As I tried Pho Saigon, I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the chicken pho and spring rolls. I usually always order size small when I get pho, but Pho Saigon only does size large, which sucks because I ended up wasting half of my soup. Plus, I was really disappointed for spending so much when I didn't eat it all (my cravings were too strong, I needed to buy pho!). Also, the broth was lacking flavor, and trust me, I love my pho so this really was mediocre. Well, moving onto my spring rolls.. the meat was so dry.. thank god I was able to drench each bite into the peanut sauce and sriracha, cos I couldnt just eat it by itself. 

Service:
I called in for a pick up order and the lady was in such a rush! Once I said my order, she quickly said, "okay give me 10 minutes" and hung up. Lol, she didn't give me a price for my order or anything, which made me not even want to go and pick up my order because I actually wanted to make sure I was getting a small size. When I arrived I said I was there for pick up and the lady said the price and it was about $17 for pho and spring rolls, so I know forsure it wasnt a small. I asked how much the price was for a small and that was when she informed me that they do not have small sizes. If I had known that from when I made the order on the phone, I would have said nevermind and didn't order at all because I forsure wouldn't finish that and I didn't want to spend that much on something I wont finish. But because I am not rude, I paid and accepted it anyway. 

Probably gonna try a different Pho joint because this just wasn't what I was expecting from reading all the good reviews.. very disappointed.

Best Pho in Vegas now that the big pho shop at Spring Mountain and Decatur closed.

I usually get chicken pho or the rare flank steak pho - it's kind of fun to get your bowl of pho full of rare beef and watch it finish cooking in the steaming broth.  I find the broth quite flavorful, but I also like to add squirts of lime, splash of rooster sauce, and sprigs of mint to kick it up a bit.  Even a "small" bowl will be plenty for you.  Noodles are plentiful and perfectly cooked.

Service can be a bit sparse, but it's gotten better.  Also, the pho gets to your table FAST - so there's not a lot of coming and going to interrupt your dinner conversation, reading, etc.  Pleasant little dining room.

Love the food, not a big fan of the service and the seating is horrible. Don't know who was the genius that bought the tables and chairs for this place because the table legs aren't wide enough to accommodate 2 chairs to where they fit UNDER the tables! Was just there last night and this lady behind me kept pushing her chair into the back of the chair next to me (which was empty, gf sat across from me)  but my chair ain't going noway because it wont fit UNDER the table, since the legs of the table isn't wide enough for 2 chairs. 

Depending of which server you get, service can be bad or decent, getting the order in can take a little while but the food does come out fast once the order is placed.

#1 is delicious, Vietnamese Fried Egg rolls wrapped in veggies then dipped in fish sauce
#15 is my favorite,  beef noodle soup with meatballs and rare round eye steak .
#66 is also very good, Grilled sliced pork over vermicelli and vegetables

Haven't ventured out of trying anything else............

i like this place!  a good pho place is hard to find, and when I get a craving for good pho, this is definitely the spot.    

the variety is awesome, and they offer rice plates as well.  the grilled pork is good.. and the seafood pho is a favorite.  we always get the eggrolls as an appetizer and it comes with fresh lettuce and cilantro to wrap them in. 

the waiters are friendly... and always good about answering my questions and getting our order right.  

i agree with the other reviews that say your practically sitting in your neighbors laps... but its usually packed so it's not a surprise that they try and accommodate a lot of ppl.  but the pho is the best i've had in vegas so far, so when it's pho the fam wants, it's saigon 8 they'll get!
I am a big Pho fan.  This place is kind of hidden in the back of a shopping complex, but it is worth finding.  The flavor is there and the serving size is pretty good.
Order food from here almost weekly. The food is great and the pho is one of the best in town. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I recommend this place.

If you love Pho, then this is  the place to get it. I have been to multiple Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas and Henderson and this is by far the best location for Pho.

I order the vegetable tofu pho and vegetable spring rolls (my most favorite Vietnamese side item) . The vegetables are always fresh. 

The down side is the customer service. None of the staff smile or seem happy for business, but the GOOD Pho out weighs the slight negative. I always come here when I'm in Henderson.
I would eat here everyday if i could.

I've ate here a few times. The service gets worse each time. This past trip we noticed the broth had an overload of MSG in the Pho. It's bad when you can notice it! Find a different option for pho, this place is a major bust!!
Came here with a few of my co workers, we had a good meal. The prices are great and the food portions are decent. I would definitely come here again. Especially when it's so close to work :P
This is a great place for noodles everything is fresh and prepared well. Everyone I've brought here really enjoyed the food  and the prices are good.

Ate lunch here and the food was excellent. 

The service was very lax and non professional. The waitresses were just sitting in the dining room chatting, the kitchen staff were outside smoking. The only person working was the waiter who was an older man. 

The food was really good and arrived to the table fast. I would recommend coming here if you don't mind being niglected after you get your food.
Food is good but SERVICE SUCKS. They forget to put in our order. Waited a long time and charges us 18% gratuity. I don't mind paying it but damn why should I tip for SUCH A HORRIBLE SERVICE.

This is the second closest Vietnamese restaurant to my locale, and is pretty much the only one I frequent if I'm close to home.

Good food, quick prep, normal service.  Vietnamese places aren't renowned for stellar customer service, guys - it's nothing personal.  =P

They recently raised the prices so don't use the online menu if placing a to-go order... Grab one inside on the counter.  That's what I did.

Their Thai tea is pretty darn good, surprisingly.  Sadly, no sauces included with noodle bowls... that's why I keep sriracha and hoisin at home.

#71 with a fried egg = nomz.

Me & my girlfriend as well as my 1yr old son love this place. Clear deep broth tells me the stock was cared after unlike a cloudy dirty looking one. Anyhow I get the 18 with all the goodies..........finish with fresh thai basil, lime & a little siracha...whats not to love.

3.5 stars

Solid pho & pretty tasty egg rolls. Besides the slightly high price for Vietnamese food, I think this place is the best in place in the Henderson area. Like all Vietnamese places, the service is fast and the waiters don't speak English. So, you can always order by the numbers next to the food item. Even though it's not the best pho I've had, I still come here regularly because of its location and good quality. Oh yeah, their fried rice is actually good too, give it a shot!

There are many-a pho restaurants that seem to be on every corner of Eastern and the 215.  My friend had heard that this was a decent spot for a bowl of pho and upon arrival I was happy to note that it was not too crowded.  Once we were seated, we ordered 2 small bowls... I can't recall the number, but it was with the rare flank steak.

The bowls came out quickly and I requested some nuoc mam sauce and lettuce to put in my soup.  Our server brought back the sauce, but not the lettuce.  I guess it's my fault for not calling him back to the table... The taste of the soup was good.  Not the best pho I have ever eaten, but decent.

The restaurant began to fill up for the lunch rush while we were eating, so I guess we got there just in time.  Our check was dropped off at the table without a word and since we had never been there we weren't really sure if we should go up to the register or wait.  We opted to walk up to the front, which seemed to be the right decision.  I then saw a sign that said Debit/Credit transactions must be over $10 and my soup was only around $7.  I expressed my concern and the lady and the register gruffly told me that I would have to add a tip... which of course I was intending on doing, but the tone and demeanor in which she said it was kind of off.  I'm not sure if I will return because I want to try out some other pho restaurants on that side of town.
Why the heck did i try this place again? ... Horrible walked out service just awful didn't even order.

Pho Saigon 8 is a solid place to get pho and they have multiple locations s in the Henderson area. 

Came with my family and we all ordered a large #18 pho which comes with rare eye steak, flank, brisket, tendon, and tripe. It was delicious and definitely a good portion of meat and noodles. A solid 4/5.

We also ordered a small bo of bun bo hue - a spicy beef noodle soup which came with a thicker noodle. Wasn't a huge fan of the broth, almost felt a bit watered down spice wise compared to what I've had at other places. For the small bowl for $9.45, I'll probably skip this for next time. 

Other than that, service was good and they gave generous portion of bean sprouts, basil, jalapeños and limes for the pho.

Tried several pho places in Vegas so far and this by far has been the best that we've had near Vegas.  Pho #21 and #24. Even better than some we've had in SF.  Soup was very flavorful and the meat was especially so.  My wife also really  enjoyed the plum drink as well, very good and soothing for dry Vegas weather.

Great food and prices!!! 
Have had several dishes and every one has been outstanding, not only the best pho but some of the best Asian food in Vegas.
And great easy to get to location right off the highway.

Food tonight was not good --- bean sprouts brown, lettuce in wraps was brown also.  The lean meat soup was good.  The service in the restaurant has never been stellar but tonight the service was the topic of our conversation- we had to stand up to get someone to come to our table for a fork- water was never refilled and when we were ready to leave I wanted a to go box and not one person would come to the table. We just decided to leave. When I went to pay the check it was more $$ than I expected and because English is not that well spoken I asked for the receipt. To my surprise they charged a 15% tip--- for a party of 5!!!! It wouldn't have been questioned if the service was good!!!   Won't be back and I will for sure tell everyone I know!

A bowl of noodles as filling and satisfying as a Thanksgiving dinner!

After spending 12 years living in Southeast Asia there is one simple meal that I miss most, a simple bowl of noodles.

Pho Saigon 8 will be my local bowl for authentic Asian noodle soup. Their noodle soups are spot on.

I had the Pho Tai Chin, rare and well cooked beef noodle soup. There are two size options, small or large for .50 cents more. The large double the size of the small and is helmet sized steaming bowl of satisfying noodle goodness. 
Before the soup arrives the server delivers the vegetable condiments that you can use to customize your bowl, don't be shy, add them all, the flavors and freshness they add lifts the noodles to a heavenly level. Also, don't forget to spice things up with a healthy squirt of Sriracha and a salty dose of hoisin sauce. There is also a wickedly delightful bowl of chili garlic sauce that adds a solid hit of heat, garlic and a touch of sour.
The rare thin sliced beef sirloin rests on top of the perfectly cooked rice noodles. Once you stir the beef into the bowl, the rare beef becomes medium well in the steaming hot broth, tender, fresh - scrumptious.
The depth of flavors is uber stimulating to the palate and the sheer volume of food is tummy satisfying. You may need a nap if you finish the whole bowl!

My wife enjoyed the Hu tieu hay Mi Dac Biet (pork soup with seafood with egg noodles). She agreed, a fantastic, tasty, satisfying bowl of noodles. The egg noodles are thin and curly. She commented that the squid was fresh and cooked perfectly.

For an authentic taste of Southeast Asia, Pho Saigon 8 can't be beat.

Their menu is extensive and includes many other non-noodle dishes that we will certainly be returning to try. We just couldn't handle anything else on top of our hot tub sized bowl of noodles!

Aloha!

There service here is so very hit or miss, most of the time they ignore you and other times your food is served seconds after being seated. The place is fairly clean but the food is awful, the pho is nothing but MSG.

Pho Saigon 8 is alright. It's not bad but not amazing. It's right there dab in the middle It's like your usual pho place. It's located near 215 and S. Eastern near LVAC. Of the 3 or 4 other pho places in the area it's maybe my #2 or 3.  It shares the parking with a few businesses and it gets pretty busy during lunch so sometimes there aren't any parking right in front and you might have to park farther. Also getting in and out might take long.

When I come here I usually get the pho with everything except the meatballs and tripe, just not a fan of it. I think it's the #21 on the menu rare eye round steak, flank, brisket, soft tendon, skirt flank. All of that with the various veggie ingredients and sauces makes a good meal very tasty.

Services is usually good. It's cluttered near the entrance. Seat a good numbers of people. There's a sign that says $10 minimum for credit charges but noticed that they aren't always strict about that policy. 

I don't always like eating here cause sometimes it doesn't feel so clean.

first time at this location in a while but the food is alright but used to be WAY BETTER. first off the fat lady at the cashier that looks like a bouncer didn't refund my fathers food because it tasted weird. she was rude and had no uniform & she looked like she was from dirt ghetto Vietnam. She probably eats all the food in the kitchen. Hope she reading this cause I'll brawl out with you any day and choke you with pho broth. and what pissed me off the most was how they only gave me one fuckin piece of chicken when there should of been 2 pieces. If I see that bitch again ima punch the weight outta her

I ordered pho that says seafood. My food came out with pork blood. I don't eat pork blood. I told the server to just put away, She rudely replied "just removed the blood!" and walked away. The server said that you ordered it and you pay for it. I didn't ask them not to charge me but just take away. She even argued saying " i told you that is not good, #40 is better" which is a lie. These kinds of people has no right to be in this business! Very very bad service, notjing doecial with food.

Dude, anything with soup/broth, noodles, and filling is always good! Ive tried several pho dishes and their spring rolls.  I'm always full with the pho.  How do they slice beef so thin?  The pho broth is everything. It ties it all in.  Pho is a PIA to make if you don't have a pressure cooker.  I can appreciate the variety and toppings of pho. I literally can eat pho everynight.  I think when winter rolls around and the next time I catch a cold, I'll see if pho can be a good alternative for chicken soup.  I've been here several times already (yet I forget to check in!!!!) and will be back again when I'm itching for some Vietnamese goodness!
I've been here a few times and it never fails me.  Their pho is seriously delicious and it's near my house!  I always order beef meatballs and fresh spring rolls with peanut butter sauce.  YUM!
Excellent Customer service worth 5 star. Pho was delicious.  The calamari was greatly seasoned and perfectly cooked. The place was clean ^-^ worth coming back! !

This place was delicious! After flying all day we ordered take out and brought this back to our suite. We ordered a seafood and chicken pho both with yellow egg noodles. 

Portions were filling, broth was tasty. Only complaint was the containers they put them in. We both ordered the large portions and struggled mixing the meat and veggies without spilling it on the table.

I've been going here for years, and it has been great. The soup comes out fast, and it comes out good. What more could someone ask for? I normally order the tendon, and they do not disappoint. Along with the rice dish of chicken, that is one of the best on the menu in my opinion. Down a star though because service could be a bit faster when getting order to send to the kitchen.

My two boys love this place. We always order the pho, Thai tea, and egg rolls. The service is fast, but not very friendly. It's a small restaurant with tight seating, a bit uncomfortable. The soup isn't usually hot enough to my liking, but temp is good for the kids. I hate the fact that they never bring you an itemize check, so you have to trust them. Mmmm...I don't think so! The floor is a bit slippery so don't wear your cute heels you might eat it. Also they don't have fountain soda, only cans (just saying). All in all decent restaurant, close to home, fast unfriendly service, tight seating (you might even make a new friend, not by choice), food is consistant, don't order soda (can) or drink the water (gross), have them give you and itemize check or repeat back your order when paying, if the soup isn't hot enough send it back, and wear shoes with grips so you won't fall on your ass. ENJOY! :)

The pho and broth was exceptional and recommend number 18 for meat lovers. 

Disappointment was with the spring rolls and service, however the pho made up for all of that.
This place is has the best PHO in Henderson. Definitely a regular

You know... I've tried a lot of Pho restaurants in Vegas but none of them has really blown me away. Much like this place... it was okay... got my fix and that was that. 

They really maximized their space though, I felt like I was eating with a group of 50. Mediocre service, price, quality... abundance of parking.

Only got 3 stars because even tho the Pho was awesome, I ordered and paid for Spring Rolls, but when I got home they weren't in the bag :( I wasn't driving all the way back during rush hour to get them. Plus my Pho would get cold.   Next time I'll check the bag before I leave.

Ordered #70 Vermicelli noodles with shrimp, pork and egg roll. Portion of noodles/meat/veggies were pretty even all around. Cooked hot & fresh.

My dad ordered #35 soup. Not sure what it was but he said he really liked the taste of it. Tangy with lots of meat!

It's not the best pho I've had but it's still good. I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come eat here though. If I'm around the neighborhood, then why not but it's not something I'm crazy about.

Disclaimer- The food is definitely four stars, but the service is one to two stars depending on the day. Therefore, I'm giving Pho Saigon 8 an overall rating of three stars.

My mom and I have been coming to Pho Saigon 8 since my family first moved to the valley, almost four years ago, and the customer service over the years has just gotten progressively worse. The staff was great when we first started coming here and then as of lately, the staff has just been rude and unpleasant to be served by. Although this restaurant is not close to home, we still drive the distance when we have that craving! We used to come at least once a week, but now every other month or so.

We usually come for lunch on the weekend, so it's always busy during that time. The wait time can be a hit or miss.

I am a creature of habit and order the same exact thing every time. I order the #11 (Pho Tái) which is the broth, noodles, and rare eye round. As far as the pho goes, the broth is always hot and never warm like other Vietnamese restaurants I have been to. It's rich in flavor and there is a good amount of rice noodles in the soup. I love the rare eye round because it's not fatty. A plate of garnishes are provided for the table to share. The traditional Thai basil, jalapeños, lime, and my favorite, crunchy bean sprouts. I love my pho with extra lime, and if more garnishes are needed, you can always ask for more! You might have to ask more than once though because they can be quite forgetful. Also, condiments are a must! A nice squeeze of Sriracha and Hoisin always go into my pho.

If I'm hungrier than usual, I'll order a plate of the crispy fried egg rolls to share. The crispy fried spring rolls are a favorite amongst my family! There are four per order and it comes with four leaves of fresh lettuce as well as the dipping sauce. I'm not too sure what the dipping sauce is made of, but it's delicious! The spring rolls are filled with pork and a variety of veggies.

Overall, the best place for pho in the Henderson area! The food is great and satisfies my craving every time. The service isn't the best, but it'll do.
Pretty decent Pho and rice dishes. The egg rolls are decent. The taste is consistent so we usually alternate btwn this pho place and another one way up the street.

Sat for 10 mins. Finally flagged server down and he took our order. 5 mins later and I still dont have a beer. They were in the weeds busy but kept seating the door for some reason. Got up and left...

I'm glad I tried Pho Saigon 8.  I ordered the pho with round, flank and meatball, but asked to replace the flank with brisket, and I'm not sure which I got, but it was inedible -- way too fatty and chewy.  Luckily, there were only 2 small slices of it, and plenty of the other 2 meats, so now I know -- next time I'll stick with the round and meatballs. 
 The basil and sprouts that came with the pho were THE FRESHEST I've seen at any pho restaurant, with no brown spots on the basil, and no yellow tinge on the sprouts.  I started with the BBQ pork rolls, which are like spring rolls but with pork instead of shrimp.  At first, I thought the meat was Spam, but it wasn't salty enough, more like thick bologna.  I've had pork rolls elsewhere where the meat was recognizable.  The peanut sauce for the rolls was thin, and not as flavorful as I'd like.  I tried a drink made of raw egg white, seltzer and condensed milk, and it was delicious.  The staff was good -- some were friendly and others were serious, but the service was excellent.

Gotta admit, saw this place on dirty dining but their food is soooo delicious!

I still go here regardless.

I love their pho as welll as their dry noodles. For the life of me, I can't think of the name of the dry noodles! Lol anyway, I also love their crispy egg rolls. So delicious and cheap!

Highly recommend!

I would never go to this place ever again. The waitress/host was so rude. She got an attitude when I asked nicely for a high hair then ignored our table for 15 mins and never bothered to even come take our orders. We got up and walked out. Worst service I've ever had.  I don't recommend this restaurant to anyone .

THIS IS THE BEST PLACE FOR PHO IN LAS VEGAS. Don't be fooled, they have another location on Spring Mtn Road in Chinatown, but this location in Henderson is much better.

For me pho comes down to 4 things. 
1. the soup. 
2. the noodles
3. the meat
4. cleanliness

The soup here is real, some places try to cut corners by not using real stock, they go with the "gaijing" or chicken/pork base, this saves hours of prep and time (and is cheaper) but the taste isn't there. If you want to know if real stock is being used, take a cup full home, put it in the fridge and if it has fat settled on the top in form of white dots, its the real deal.
