THIS PLACE USES REAL STOCK AND THE FLAVOR IS REALLY REALLY GOOD.

The noodles here are good, they don't give you a ton, so if you are a big eater like myself you can order extra, or load up on the sprouts and basil. I am 6'4 and push 300 lbs, this place fills me up with out extra noodles, mainly due to the generous portion of meat.

The meat here is perfect. IT IS CUT THIN!!! There are so many pho places that simply slice their meat too thick and it tastes chalky and hard to digest. Here they do it perfect. The rare eye of the round, brisket and fatty brisket are perfect. I get the #18 that comes with all the above with tendon and tripe.

You can tell this place is well taken care of. The hoisin sauce bottle is clean, the hot sauce container doesnt have 3 week old hot sauce jerky hanging from it (foodies will know what i mean) and the place is decorated nicely, service is fast and nice.

We live 2 mins from Chinatown but will travel 30 mins to Henderson to eat here. BEST PLACE FOR PHO IN LAS VEGAS, HANDS DOWN.

i've tried a lot of pho places here in the vegas area and i must say pho saigon 8 henderson location is so convenient being away from the strip. shrimp spring rolls with no pork, is great with peanut sauce and a hint of sriracha sauce. they taste so fresh compared to other places. i get chicken vermicelli and i love it. but (-1 star) for their service, they can work on smiling and refilling water faster.

I am always pleased and quite full when I leave here.  Don't bother with Pho Mailan up the street, you can read my post about them as to why.  It's better than Lemongrass which is almost across the street.
As for the people whose problem with this place is service....  In my not-so-humble opinion, crappy service is quite common in southeast Asian cuisine restaurants.  Many seem to lack any personality, and any server etiquette.  Same applies here.  But the food is consistently great and I've never been let down.
So yum. Always busy and service is good. Have only had spring rolls and Pho. Happy girl.

Quick service, large portion sizes, relatively clean, good desserts, decent prices.  The flavor of pho was good but a little on the blander side, but I actually prefer it that way because I don't feel like I ate a boullion cube with the pho soup.  I was really impressed by the clean bean sprouts. My family and I eat a lot of pho at a lot of Vietnamese restaurants and this is only the second time ever that the bean sprouts came with the root ends plucked off.

LIke I've said..I only eat here when my BF wants his Beefstew pho! 

Service is not that great. I don't know if its just the way they staff it. Then the pho wasn't great today. Not tasty and a lot less noodles. Some days I'll have too much.

Seriously yummy Phò!  The broth is amazing. I usually always get the #11.  The "add in's" are always super fresh and fragrant and they serve  very generous portions.  

The soup comes in two sizes, they just have the price for the large size in the menu, you need to ask for a small if you want that.  

My friend introduced me about a month ago, and I have been back 3 times already.  You could say it's my new favorite.

The service is very fast, but strictly business.  Never anyone rude or unhelpful, but not warm or inviting really either.  But seriously I couldn't care less the soup is amazing and I don't necessarily care for overly talkative waiters anyhow.

I'm from southern californa, and I'm vietnamese so I think I've had my fair share of "authentic" vietnamese food, and I think Pho Saigon 8 does a pretty good job. And for a decent price too! 

I've gotten the Pho Bo Vien (meat ball Pho) which was good. The broth was a good flavor. I always add tons of lemon and Hoisin Sauce anyway. 

And I've had their Rice platter with grilled pork (Thit Nuong) and egg rolls. I thought the meat was awesome. It had a good flavor and the egg rolls were pretty good too. My one complaint is that the rice wasn't your typical "broken rice" where the rice pieces are smaller. They served whole rice grains, which is fine but I was really looking foward to the traditional Com Tam.

My fiance has gotten their Bun Thit Nuong (Dry noodle bowl with grilled pork) and he didn't have any complaints. The fish sauce (Nuoc Mam) was decent, nothing too spectacular. 

And the service isn't too bad either. I've gone when they've been pretty busy and I thought the service was moderately attentive. Overall this is a great place to go when you're craving a nice steaming bowl of noodle soup or just some good ole vietnamese food and you're too lazy to drive down to Spring Mountain haha.

My go-to pho place in town! Pho Saigon 8 serves the best pho in the area hands down, and I've gone to quite a few of the other Vietnamese restaurants in town to find the perfect place. I'm from Orange County where there is some of the best pho restaurants you can find, so my standards were pretty high when I went on this search. Trust me when I say the best is here. 

The wait staff is friendly and the food comes out super duper quick. They are always pretty busy but I have never had to wait for a table to be available. 

The only fall back is that you are going be in close proximity to those around you, whether it be at your table or the table next to you. The tables feel kind of small and you have to be mindful when maneuvering around so you don't knock into other people... but this is a small price to pay! And speaking of price, the dishes are very affordable :)
Soup is ultra salty .  Good portion of food thought ..ok   acceptable .    Casual lunch
Ughhh nothing worse than half ass food. I had the pho here before but today I ordered the grilled chicken with rice. Needless to say... I will never order that again. Strictly only pho here.

This place is great for lunch!  The service is quick, the food is relatively fast and always tastes great!  I stopped in for a late lunch (closer to 2 or 2:30pm), and it wasn't busy at all.  During peak lunch rush there can be a wait.

The menu has lots to choose from.  I've gotten into the habit of getting the same things each time I go - but otherwise I'd say try something new once in a while.

The atmosphere is very casual.  Great food!
Amazing as usual! I go to this Pho spot after every EDC the AC is blasting and the food is great. Recovery to the fullest

Maybe not the best PHO I've had but definitely decent and worth trying! I'll be frequenting this joint for take-out since it satisfies my cravings for Vietnamese food. The place itself is very clean, modern, and service is pretty darn good. It's a comfortable environment and it's not in Spring Mountain mixed in the cluster of Asian restaurants. That's a plus! Oh, and the menu is pretty comprehensive so you'll find something!

Pretty solid pho spot. I always order the small #7, which is just pho with the rare flank. I get my pho pretty basic since I don't like all that meat. Their rice dishes are pretty solid too. The BBQ pork is really flavorful and tender, even when you eat it the next day as left overs. Not a huge fan of their service. The couple times I've been here, the servers speak little English. It's great pho, and the service is quick and smooth. I've come here a couple times and every time has been very pleasant. It's comfort comfort food for me, so it is nice to come someplace welcoming and with good food.

I would never ever come back to this place ever again and it was my first time here. I wish there was a way to rate this place 0 stars. They're customer service sucks. They never came to check on us so I never got a chance to tell them that the broth sucks and that the noodles they gave me were broken into pieces. I told the "Guy" in charge and he made it seem like I didn't know what I was talking about. I was simply just letting them know that I didn't like it it wasn't cause I wasn't trying to pay. They were very rude about acknowledging the issue. DONT COME HERE even the spring rolls were tough!!! I didn't even get an apology

This is the best pho in town. Their broth is always on point! Service is fast, even when it gets busy. The quality of foods is always high. Prices are a little higher than others but it's definitely worth it! If you're looking for good quality pho, this is definitely the spot
My go to spot for Pho noodle. The food is hot and delicious!!! Try the spring rolls!

Everything is great and beyond my expectation for Vietnamese food in Vegas. Their pho is yummy and the vegetable is always fresh especially the bean sprout. I definitely recommend to try other food such as egg-roll or udon, you will be surprise how good their food is. Thumb up for the service!

Easily Pho-gotten Experience

Can't really comment on the sister restaurant in Spring Mountain, but I stopped by here since I currently reside on the east part of town and I wanted to check out the Las Vegas Athletic Club located not far behind.

A good way to judge a Vietnamese restaurant is the quality of the their beef pho broth.  While I was fairly hungry having scheduled a late lunch, I was both delighted and simultaneously skeptical regarding the fact that my steaming bowl of beef pho with flank steak and tendon came within 2 minutes of placing my order.  One of my Vietnamese friends taught me some easy signs to spot a good broth are through sight and smell prior to tasting.  One should detect an immediate aroma upon the bowl being placed at your table and I'm not sure if that was the case.  The clarity of the broth both in term of being able to visualize the ingredients and the absence of an abundance of oil at the surface also is a positive sign and this broth appeared to pass the sight test. 

Poking my chopsticks around followed by adding the standard sides (sprouts, jalapenos, lime, and basil), I began to slurp and taste.  The noodles were the right texture and not overly clumped together, although this can be the most forgivable fault if all else is right.  The meat was problematic in that the thin slices were clumped together like miniature meat softballs and the only way of preventing any undercooked areas would be to OVERCOOK the whole mass.  Anthony Bourdain once commented in his book Kitchen Confidential that one should never order steak well done since you will likely get the worst cut of meat available since one cannot tell the difference between the best and worst when it is well done.  I feel the same holds true when you are trying to assess the quality of the thinly sliced beef in one's pho.  The tendon was actually the star in that they were sliced with a good combination of collagenous goodness and the occasional hint of meat and cooked to perfection. 

 Last but not least, the broth is what makes or breaks the dish, and in this case, my nose trumped my eyes in that the taste of the broth was fairly one-dimensional.   The broth is usually a matter of pride amongst Vietnamese moms and no two are alike since hours to days are spent perfecting the signature combination of beef bones, ginger, onion, and aromatics (cinnamon, anise. cloves, peppercorns, etc) guarded in households much like the Colonel Sanders' original recipe.  I could barely detect anything beyond a mild sweetness which could have been MSG or a bouillion cube (we'll see how thirsty I am a few hours from writing this review).  I am probably being overcritical since I have had some great broths in the past, so I will say that much like the clientele which was mostly of mixed caucasian/asian couples, this place would be a great primer for someone new to pho since I would think perhaps the addition of the other subtle flavors may weird out the newcomers and sometimes one has to sample an average broth to appreciate an excellent broth.  

P.S.  Probably the only pet peeve of mine is avoid taking home noodle soups unless you plan on consuming them later that night.  It is a food crime to eat them as leftovers when the noodles have had a chance to get soggy and release their starches and muddle the broth.

Pho broth clean, not oily, full flavored - beautiful broth. 

Very generous with their meats in the pho - I couldn't even finish a small bowl. I got the combo with tendon, flank, eye of round, etc. What I love about their pho is that they aren't afraid to give you fat. A little fat on the meats is a wonderful thing, especially since the broth is so light.

Restaurant very clean and tidy.

Small and cozy place to eat with low light setting.
I was happy with the food that we order. I got "com suong bi cha thit nuong" which is not bad. My friends say the pho is good too. Would come back.
Our new favorite place for Pho. The amount of meat they give you beats any other I've ever had. The broth is great. Perfect for anything that ails you!

3 stars.

This is the location just next to the massive LVAC on 215 and Eastern. Its in that little center on the corner right next to Teriyaki Boy.

The place is pretty small and feels really cramped if there are more than a hndful of people inside. 

As for the food itself, its alright. On my last trip here I had the chicken pho and it was good. Tasty broth and nice juicy chicken. I think there was too much cilantro in mine, but it certainly wasn't a deal breaker.

Service was okay. 

I dont know, nothing was terrible, but at the same time nothing really stood out either. I think the Lemongrass Cafe nearby is probably a better choice for some good Pho.

So 3 stars it is.
Service has definitely gotten worse over the years, it's a shame this is one of the only places near Henderson.

I just got back from a two week trip to Vietnam and was excited to test out Pho Saigon 8 after reading some good reviews from John Curtis.  

First, I noticed that some have complained about the service.  It's not prompt, or attentive, but trust me, that's authentic!  In Vietnam servers don't get tipped so they have no reason to be attentive, and there you have to ask for your check... So, if it really is Vietnamese staff working there, expect to have to request your check and realize that it's not rude to approach them.

Now for the food!  We ordered vegetarian spring rolls which were tasty, although they could have used some more herby additions.  The dipping sauce was delicious!  We split the Pho Tai (thin strips of beef in the beef pho broth).  The pho was good, not the best I've had, but a solid middle of the road.  It was pretty flavorful, add-ins are appropriate (giant basil, bean sprouts, hot peppers).  But, what impressed me was that they had the rice crepes that have become my favorite Vietnamese meal!

The crepe is made with rice flour (it's a savory crepe, folks), cooked in a pan until a bit crispy, and filled with bean sprouts, shrimp, and pork.  It comes with a fish sauce based dripping sauce that augments this dish wonderfully.  With this meal (which appears in the appetizer section, but I use as a main course) comes a giant plate of ruffage.  The proper execution is to take a lettuce leaf, cut off a chunk of the crepe + filling, and use the lettuce leaf as a wrap to make your own little spring roll out of it.  Add in the carrot, some kind of other root vegetable, and mint that they provide.  The rolls are cool and crunchy on the outside, warm, crunchy, and flavorful on the inside.  Don't forget the dipping sauce, it's well worth it.

Most Vietnamese restaurants in town don't extend past pho and some stir-fried rice dishes, and maybe a "clay pot" type dish if you're lucky.  This rice "crepe" will keep me coming back for more, yum!

Amazing, tasty bowls of goodness! The prices were excellent for the portion size. Great for any time of day, this soup will put you in a full, healthy mood. Superb balance of soup and meats. Service was quick, but communication was a stretch. I still would go there everyday if I could!
The Pho is good of course but nobody in town can beat their fresh spring rolls..I just hate the fact that this place closes so f!#*ing early..

Over the years I've come to appreciate Pho Saigon 8. It's not perfect but warrants higher than my previous two star rating. Went there for lunch today and the line was crazy long. Should've seen that coming on a cloudy/rainy day. Pho just seems to go so well on cloudy days, doesn't it?

I had the pho and damn I have to give it to them for their consistency. The flavor hasn't changed in years so you always know what you're getting. Your expectations will always be met. I didn't like the fact that the noodles were still pretty hard and had to sit in the broth for it to soften but it's not the end of the world.

The egg rolls are good and the peanut sauce is actually better than other places I've had it at. The service has gotten much, much better over the years. This is probably my pho spot on this side of town.

This has been my go to Vietnamese spot since I've lived here. Consistent and good Vietnamese food at a fair price. The service could always be better, but that usually goes for most Vietnamese food spots. I will say I do like that they bring out scissors to cut the kid's noodles, this helps.

This place is great if you're looking for a quick lunch or dinner. Their ph is pretty good and their servings are pretty large as well. I always order the egg rolls as well whenever I come here because they are very delicious, and never overly fried. Most of the time I've gone here, customer service has always been average and tonight was just horrible. The staff was just not attentive and were were given attitude the whole time. I definitely won't be coming back here anytime soon.
The fact that the server wasn't friendly enough ticked me of. I rather eat at a Thai Restaurant anytime. I didn't try anything at all. My friend said it was good. He tried the soup or something.

First timers. Felt optimistic because it was packed, must be a good place right? We ordered egg rolls and halfway through saw a giant bug crawling around the lettuce. Bug in the food. Need I say more? If one is crawling around our food, imagine the kitchen. Couldn't get the feeling that I ate bug filled egg rolls out of my mind, total bummer.

Let it be said that there is absolutely nothing horrible about this place.  Everything is just mediocre.  

First, the decor was the best thing about it.  It was new, well-painted, pretty paintings and new chairs and tables with granite on top.  There were nice fake plants on the ceilings and walls, and the bathroom was clean, and nice.  The problem is that the tables had this bar under them where my friend kept hitting his knees against.  The tables were set so close together that I could probably have reached over to the other table and stolen a spring roll off of it.

Speaking of the spring rolls, they were just not good.  The flour sheets on the spring rolls were chewy, and they did not have that nice crunchy stuff in the center that tastes really good, like the ones at Lemongrass.  The dipping sauce was good, but not exceptional.

The pho was the biggest let-down today.  Pho Saigon 8 on Spring Mountain had rich, full broth, that seemed just a little too fatty, and was very good.  This one was rather thin, and its flavor was easily masked by any of the things that you could put in it.  For example, more basil meant that the pho tasted like basil and not pho.  Add bean sprouts, and the pho tasted like water and not much else.  The meat was good, though, and they put a liberal amount of green onion, which I always like.

I also tried the lemon soda.  This was a very good soda, although it was much too sweet.  I think it could have benefited from having more lemon flavor and less sugar in it.  

They have no sandwiches.  

In addition, everything there is smaller, and/or more expensive than Lemongrass, right across the street.  For example, the large pho was the same price for both, but the bowl is smaller was easily finished by myself and my friend.  We've almost never finished a large pho at Lemongrass.  The Vietnamese seafood crepe was both smaller *and* more expensive, by as much as $0.50-$1.00, and while good, made me a little skittish about ordering it again.  The Spring Rolls were the same price, but came with only two instead of three like at Lemongrass.  

Much as I want to see more pho places around, I simply cannot recommend this place with Lemongrass Cafe so close to it.  Maybe if it was in the middle of rural Nevada with no other competition, it would have impressed me more.  I'm sorry, Pho Saigon 8 :/
fast service great pho !!!! i love their wonton soup and combo fried rice !!! i know they improved in cleanliness from dirty dining over 2 years ago!!!! keep at it PLEASE!

I'm new to Vietnamese cuisine. I have been to a few spots in town & I must say the chicken pho was phenomenal! Lots of meat, veggies & awesome noodles. The broth was NOT salty, it was perfection. 

My mom tried the veggie pho with tofu, broccoli, bok choy, carrots & onions. She was in heaven. 

We also ordered tofu spring rolls.. Did not disappoint. 

I will definitely return.

Decent food, fast service and good prices.
Service is so-so! We went around 8:15 and they were closing at 9pm.
One of the servers came by the table and pick up the sauce bottle even before e ordered something. Later on, after we were already eating, one of the servers stop putting the chairs up and sweeping under the table right next to us, event if it was 8:50 only. Would eat there, if I have huge crave and I want something quick, but I would check other places as well

Decent pho.  Not the best nor the worst but it hits the spot.  Their springs rolls were mediocre so I would recommend skipping that since it's not worth the cost.

I thought it was annoying how they listed all these different combos for pho.  I usually like to order everything in my beef pho (flank, steak, tripe, tendon, etc) so it would have been nice to have one that is labeled the works or something.  Oh and they charge extra if you want meatball so you have been warned.

Btw, you pay at the counter. ;)

the food here is always good, lately the carry out service has gone to sh!t, they'll tell u 15 minutes then it'll take a half hour, & they'll just leave it on the counter when it's done until u ask.  today the guy then asked for my order number & receipt which they never gave me & tried to make me pay a second time when I had just paid and sat there waiting

I spent my childhood in Vietnam and my young adulthood in Orange County where the best Vietnamese food is outside of Vietnam.  Having said that, this restaurant is a good substitute of Orange County Vietnamese food.  

Most non-Vietnamese will come here for pho, and their beef pho is good.  But their chicken pho is better.  You can order it with white meat or dark meat or a combination of both.  I prefer the combination.  You can also get Mien Ga, which is a noodle soup with the chicken pho broth and bean thread noodle, very healthy and yummy (bean thread noodle is a good source of fiber).  

Another good dish here is the Hu Tieu My Tho, which is a noodle soup with pork broth, clear & chewy rice noodle, topped with shrimp, calamari, ground pork, and quail eggs.  It is a very authentic dish from south Vietnam and Pho Saigon 8 has a very good version.  

As with most Vietnamese restaurants, the service can be slow and sporadic but the decor is nicer than many other Vietnamese restaurants in town.  I really recommend this place if you are in the Southeast side of Vegas.

Horrible service! They took my order incorrectly, we returned to pick up the correct order, no apology, no discount for us having to return back to their store a second time and they didn't even refund the order that we paid for that was incorrect in the first place! They have a bad attitude and horrible service!! Don't go here! There's another pho place right down the street in the same parking lot of inn and out and their service is sooooo much better!!!

I didn't get any headache after having their #72.  Usually I'll get a headache after consuming MSG.  The meat was soft and tender.  Vegetables are fresh.  Staffs are friendly.  I can't say anything bad about this place.

Unless I am so far from this location AKA in Centennial Hills I'll travel to go to Pho Saigon 8. Nothing beats this place. I wish the prices hadn't raise almost a dollar, but that's inflation for you. Oh well, I'll still come back!!

Atrocious service. Seriously the worst. Bad attitudes, grim faces. The food is good if you can get someone to serve you. No welcome. No greeting. No thank you. They make you feel like a burden. Deserve zero stars but the food is good enough if you're desperate and patient

The Pho is really good here.  I love the little cart on the table with all the equipment you need including sriracha and what I think is eel sauce?  They are really quick, you order and they bring it out within minutes.  The size large is super large though!  The decor is odd, but not bad for a Mom and Pop Shop atmosphere.  It is pretty cheap too, I think I spent $11.00 on mine for a large bowl and water to drink.  I really loved the fresh basil leaves, it was delicious.

Came late night for dinner and even though we were the last ones there the food was still great. We ordered the Saigon noodle soup (#51 I believe) and it had an amazing flavor. We also tried #53 the fried noodle with meat, seafood, and veggie and it was delicious. We had a good overall experience and the waitress was nice about suggesting certain popular dishes and her favorites.

I have traveled to many different establishments in search of some pho that matches the taste and quality of my mother in laws. Pho Saigon 8 on eastern and 215 is the closest yet. I routinely get the number 11. It comes with a plate of different garnishes such as bean sprouts, mint leaves, and sliced jalapeño peppers.  I add plumb sauce and saracha for an extra added kick that broadens the journey through taste town.  It tastes like life. It's a spiritual journey for me every time I dive into a bowl of this magic bone broth, thin sliced raw meat, and noodles. It's always clean and I've never had to wait to be seated.  The place stays full with a steady stream of regulars and workout veterans from across the parking lot. The café ser da is another amazing coffee treat that will spark off your day proper.  I've had a few other items off the menu, all of which were rich with flavor and filling. The meals are reasonably-priced and the service has always been superior. If you are a fan of delicious food from Veit Nam, a stop by here won't dissapoint. Lastly, don't fear the fish sauce.

This is the only place my wife will get pho. We have tried other places but she said they don't compare to a bowl you'll get here. I usually stick to a rice dish and a meat and recently had the pork plate with white rice and egg roll. I don't remember the number but it was a great portion for the price.

The service is hit and miss as you might not get a waiter back at the table after you've ordered.  Food comes out pretty fast especially if you have ordered the pho.

Good place to go for pho if you're craving noodles and not in Chinatown. My friends and I went here on a Saturday night, and were pleased that it wasn't too busy. After perusing the menu, my friend and I decided to split a large #11 (Pho Tai- Noodle soup with rare round eye steak, $7.50) while my other friend ordered the #67 (Bun Ga Nuong- Grilled chicken over vermicelli and vegetables, $7.45). I asked for extra bean sprouts to which the waiter didn't seem to have a problem with. Our food came out quickly, which was a plus. 

Pho Tai- Better here than other pho places in the neighborhood. The noodles were the perfect texture- not overcooked, but still soft with a chewy bite. The soup was a little more oily (I could see oil puddles floating on the top) than what I'm used to, but still good and hot nonetheless. And the accompanying plate of veggies & herbs (bean sprouts, basil & lemon (not technically a vegetable or herb...) was fresh. The portion size was good- plenty of noodles & meat- with the addition of bean sprouts, I was definitely full. 

Bun Ga Nuong- I only tried the grilled chicken, which I thought was flavorful and very teriyaki-y, but some of the pieces that I ate had too much fat on them; however, I liked the sweetness and charred flavor of the chicken. 

I didn't really feel like the service was bad. I mean it did take a while for them to bring the check, but my friends and I didn't really have a problem with that because we were too busy talking. I thought the servers were nice. I also like how this place is cleaner than other pho restaurants I've been to. So I think I'll come back when I'm craving pho not only because the food is good, but because it's located right next to my favorite frozen yogurt shop.

It was 8:30 p.m. on a cool Thursday evening. My daughter and I had just been in the neighborhood and thought about eating Pho. We had seen this restaurant many times as we drove by but never stopped in. I wish we never had. We walked in and there was no one in the establishment. One of the employees were cleaning the floors and chairs were pulled out from the tables. We asked if they were open and the owner waved us in and we sat. (They close at 10:00p.m.)The two flat screen tvs were off and it was very quiet....really quiet. We ordered a large pho tai and salt and pepper shrimp to share. The soup broth was not the best and you could see alot of oil floating on top and not to mention hardly any noodles. We were thirsty from the saltiness and needed a refill on water but all the employees and the owner were sitting down eating dinner. I had to get up and ask for service. Three other tables came in and were seated at 8:45pm. Once their food was delivered the employees once again sat at "their" table and continued eating. I had to stand up once again to ask for the check. I'm sorry I had not gone to Lemongrass Cafe to eat in the first place. We will never go back to this establishment. One more thing. As one of the employees brought our dish of the shrimp, he asked if we wanted rice (which comes with this order). We said yes and as he walked bakc to the kitchen, sneezed a very large, loud, yucky sneeze, we almost didn't want the rice!!!!! Gross!

I used to love this place. I've been here quite a few times over the past year or so. Quality has gone down and service always bad. I've yet to have my water refilled here, ever. You have to flag someone down if you want a to go box, extras, a napkin, anything. .. Sometimes I've been ignored. I went recently and the soup was cold, broth not as great as it's been and my meat looked old and had spots??? On it.... There was also something in identifiable in the soup. I always order the same kind so not sure what was up. I'm very disappointed and may just find a better place from now on.

This place is just as good as the original one on Spring Mountain.  The good news for me is that it's right next to my office so I intend to sample everything off of their extensive menu instead of just the pho which I normally get.

Just in the last few weeks since it's opened I've tried some new stuff like the #2 veggie spring rolls which had some good tofu inside, #7 Banh Xeo which I really liked (its like putting a savory, greasy shrimp pancake inside a lettuce wrap and then adding fresh mint and dipping into sauce) and the #73 Bun Bo Hue which was a little underwhelming.  

The manager, Eric, is really nice and helpful.  I will be going back again and again until I've tried it all!

The food is good and they are very quick and friendly

Only drawback, I don't know how many English speaking customers they get  here, but there it's usually not a member of the waitstaff who speaks any form of English. You usually have to point at the menu and hope for the best..

This place isn't as good as the spring mountain location, but it's a great lunch spot for me n my coworkers. The service is not too bad and it's fairly clean. The pho broth is tasty and better than anything else in the SE. Lemongrass n pho little Saigon across the street aren't as good. I think this place is more of a 3.5 stars, but I give them the benefit of the doubt.
Broth is wayyyy too oily.  What Viet restaurant doesn't have Tai Sac on the menu?  Rice dishes aren't great either.

This place has the right grilled pork dry vermicelli bowl that I like. I would suggest trying that dish here. Lemongrass has half the amount of the same dish, and this place makes it the way I like it. I'd recommended it to my friend, and he likes it too. Pho is okay here, I would prefer Lemongrass for if I wanted pho.

This restaurant had great food and a clean, comfy environment. There were 30+ types of pho. I loved the vegetarian Vietnamese spring rolls with peanut sauce. I appreciated the sturdy armless chairs and sturdy tables as well. The servers were friendly and helpful. A+++
Im a fan of the one on spring mnt but I thought I try this one. I must say the service was good and pleasant. The noodles were a bit over cooked and mushy but the pho was still good.

This is now the best Pho restaurant in town. Excellent customer service and the pho are amazingly, addictive. Better than Pho Kim long! 

If the drinks were free refills, then it would be 5 stars hands down! 

Overall, excellent place! Booyah!

Service is fast.  Bring the family here twice a month.  Large portions of the Pho with great broth and they do not skimp on the side ingredients.  Great price for the food.  The #11 is fantastic, meat is lean and not fatty.

bun bo hue yummy,
but i dont understand about the purple basil.
but i  tried ,the first i ate purple basil.
the taste difficult for me, but my hubby like it.
this place  my  friend  recommend for me.
i believe her, because she live at henderson ,las vegas.

It is located where The American Grill used to be.

I have prepared more Vietnamese food at home than I have dined out.
That being said , I found it to be tasty.

I had the Hue Style Hot & Spicy Soup, although not spicy enough.  
A little Rooster Sauce took care of that though...

We went in the first few days of them being open.  
The service was ok.  Hopefully, it will get better.

I think we'll try Lemongrass Cafe next time...

I went here a couple days ago and I loved this place. I ordered the well done beef with beef meatballs and it was delicious! You can tell this is your better than your average pho restaurant because the locals seem to love it and it was packed when I went in the early evening. Don't know why it has a 3 star rating...should either be 4 or 5 stars.

Also, you know it's a good pho restaurant because it has pho in its name and a random number.

Went there on a 6/18/16 Saturday, around 4 during EDC week and wanted some comfort food so searched for the closes place I could get pho from my resort... 

Service: no complains at all... Unfortunately I didn't get his name, only saw he was wearing a white Nike hat. I changed my order after I've ordered already cause I couldn't make up my mind, he did not give me any ugly looks, my ice water was never empty, always has a smile on his face and that's major plus to the restaurant... I was a server as well so I pay extra attention to servers performance and he did great.

Now food, here's the down side... I ordered a large Bun Bo Hue and instead of regular noodles I requested for pho noodles (personal liking, chewier). It could've definitely use a lil more flavor for sure, I ordered pho so it would be more chewy... But mines came out really soft, kinda disappointment... It was filling... But I did order a large. 

Service was great
Food wise wasn't bad, but definitely had better
That's what took the star away for me
Will go back for sure, to see if it'll be better to get that five star

Always good pho !
Love their spring rolls.
Good Char meats - beef, pork, chicken and pork chops.
Fast friendly service.
Would highly recommend .

We came here on a weekday for lunch. The food is pretty decent but the service is where they're lacking most. Someone was seated a few minutes after us on a connected table and they took her order first and instead of taking ours immediately after, they left and came back.

Located around the corner from Yogurtland with kind of a limited amount of parking is this wonderful place. Honestly I only get the bun bo hue here and it's a spicy beef noodle soup. It's perfect for a rainy cold day. It's not too spicy and they do offer chili oil to make it spicier if you'd like. My husband always gets just the reg pho tai which is just thinly sliced beef in a clear bone broth.  The give ample veggies (like bean sprouts, mint, basil and jalapeños) to add to your soup. So here's the big secret about Vietnamese soup....best hangover cure ever!!!! The noodles to absorb all the alcohol, the meat to fill your belly, and the natural oils from the broth to satisfy that need for greasy food with a healthier option!

I got take out so this is just my observation from the waiting area. Plenty of local customers so this place is popular. It's located off the 215 at Eastern so you don't have to drive 30 minutes to the Chinatown area of Vegas for Pho. But they have yummy Bun Bo Hue, Banh Xeo, goi cuon rolls and decent. Vegetarian selections too.

This place is absolutely amazing. If I could eat here every day I definitely would. I have to say, this is my favorite restaurant ever. I am a HUGE fan of #56 is a plate of Korean barbecue pork, rice, egg rolls, salad and broth. I always come with the thought of trying something new but I am hooked with this dish, I will never be able to say no to it. The prices of the food great.

Vietnamese BBQ  Shrimp Vermicelli or Bun Tom topped with grilled pork (thit),  is my favorite Vietnamese dish!   I love Vietnamese bun because it's not only tasty, but very healthy as it's not greasy and comes with all sorts of vegetables and herbs. Every bite is refreshing and appetizing; a noodle dish that is both filling and satisfying. Most people who have tried Vietnamese food are familiar with Pho, unfortunately for me it's fun to say but not to eat, I've just never had a taste for it.  So, if you're like me and have family and friends who dig Pho give this dish a try.  You're welcome!  And don't forget the Thai tea with boba.

The service sucks. They lost a customer over $8. Is that what the 8 stands for? ? My food wasn't good, so I asked for a different item & the server told me I should've read the menu better & what happens if I don't like my next dish? Will I keep asking for more? I told him I come two to three times a week so I know what to expect & he said he sees a million faces a day how would he remember. I wasn't expecting him to remember I was just trying to make it clear I know what their food is supposed to taste like. On to the next pho restaurant down the street.

I've been here a number of times and mostly enjoyed the food. The service is pretty mediocre but I don't blame them-- at least they try. 

The eggrolls are different here, and while they aren't my cup of tea, seem to be popular among other regular patrons.

The prices are pretty fair for the amount of food you get--you'll be pretty full from just one bowl of soup. I love the traditional leaves and beansprouts that they serve alongside the pho. I always douse mine in hot sauce as well. When I've got a really bad cold, there's nothing I crave more than a steaming hot bowl of spicy, salty, hydrating pho. However, I've been elsewhere in clark county and must say that this is far from the best pho in town. Its conveniently located for me but don't settle for this place because there is much better to be had in the asian districts closer to the strip.

This place is always  busy but it beats driving all the way to Chinatown. Food is delicious  I like their  tendon and beef pho. I also order their small egg rolls with lettuce. Their combination  with noodles and shrimp is great. I just  wish they speak more  English.

I do like this location simply because they do takeout and its nice to take my pho home. Admittedly they only get 4 stars because sometimes I've called in an order, they tell me it will be ten minutes and by the time I get there, my order is not ready nor does anyone seem to recall me having put one in. I go at least 3 times a month if I can. The males seem to do this more then the females working there. It has happened more then once and it does get annoying after awhile. It is also a hit or miss sometimes with the soup itself. There have been times I have gotten meat that appears a little off putting and I get sick after eating it. It's rare but it does happen.

Overall I enjoy coming here, as I can just pick up my soup after I get off work and go. Admittedly I wish they stayed open until 11 instead of ten like their spring mountain locations but otherwise no other complaints.

Great place amazing customer service and food! This place is very clean and the pho is amazing! My wife and I had the spring rolls which were Nom Nom! I had the #23 meatball and beef the noodles and meat we great! My wife had the #61(?) egg noodles and wontons! All in all we will for sure be going back. everyone was very nice and refilled drinks fast which is a plus for me! Plus they have some good beers!
Came here with a friend for the first time to try out pho. If you don't know what you're doing don't order the large pho bowl. It's hard to finish everything. But I loved trying something new.
This is my fav location for pho in vegas and I've had it everywhere! They give you a lot of chicken they're fast and the flavor is the best pho around :)

Hubby and brother-in-law wanted to eat Bun Bo Hue so we chose this place.  I've had it here before and it is quite decent.  However, this will be the last time I eat here.  

Both hubby and BIL ordered the Bun Bo Hue Large and I ordered the small.  The bowls came out quickly and as they were finishing up their bowl, I finished almost 1/4 when I noticed a bug that looks similar to a rollie pollie in my bowl of soup.  I spooned it out, waved down our waiter, and at first glance, he said, "it's good.."  I said, "that's a bug in my soup."  He took the spoon with the bug and brought it back to the kitchen.  Moments later, another waitress that spoke fluent English came out to apologize and ask if i want anything else.  At that point, I am disgusted already so I said no and check please.  

They took off the small bowl of Bun Bo Hue off of the check, but still charged for the bowls of the same soup that hubby and BIL ate.  We came to the conclusion that the bug must have been in the big pot of soup that they served to all customers as how else will the bug appear in the soup.  But nope, if they continued to charge us for the two bowls, we are sure they continued to serve that to other customers.  

Very disappointed and will not return.

Horrible service!!! They said 10 minute wait for my party of 6, we waited almost 20 minutes when a party of 2 were seated. Continuing to wait another 10 minutes 4 people walk in and go to seat themselves. I explain to the hostess that they just cut us. Apparently, they were joining the previous party of 2. The hostess said that she was saving a bigger table for my party. I then explained to her the 2 people + 4 more =6. She continued to be passive and not tell the 4 people whom just walked in that we were next. This place is awful, no wonder why it only has 3 1/2 !

Wow!!! From my last review I talked about customer service being my only problem but ever since then, I came here 3 more times in 2 weeks and every single time was AMAZING customer service! Even the last time I came in today they were extremely busy yet greeted everyone and sat them right away! Service was so fast and attentive and everyone was so nice! This definitely adds the final star to complete my review! My favorite pho place of all time! Perfectly yummy and GREAT service now too!!!

My family and I love this place. The ambiance could be better, but the speed of service and helpful happy staff make up for the decor. All the ingredients are super fresh. 

We usually get the pho beefballs and lean beef, we also get the spring rolls. Yum!!! You won't regret you are here!!

I always order #29 and it's really good but service sucks big time. I don't mind waiting if they're busy but it's the second time that a friend and I were kept waiting while another couple that walked in after we've been seating and ready to order, got not only their drinks first but also their food way ahead of us. Not cool. Not going back.

This is definitely a good second option for all of the east siders that can't make it to Chinatown for Vietnamese...

This is a true asian noodle shop...  much more focus on the food than the service.  Pho and spring rolls always tasty and come out quick, but definitely need to make eye contact with a server to get your check when you're finally done.
I love the Pho here, always fresh and delicious. My favorite in Henderson. Friendly service too!!

I've been here many times, and each time I always think "Why do you keep coming back here??"  The service is *horrible* and the food is just okay.  They recently raised their prices, so I have less incentive than ever to come back.  The waiters always act like they are so annoyed to be serving you.  Last time I went, I ordered a pho with tripe, but there was no tripe in my bowl.  When I tried to tell my waiter, he just laughed.  I don't think he understood me, but instead of trying to, he just laughed and walked away.  Never going back.
In my top 5 places to eat Pho. Not number 1, but it is most definitely up there. The service is good and the seating is fast. I will come again.

I guess it's little healthier soup base hence the blandness in flavor. rather go to Pho Thanh Huong on Tropicana or the other place down the street from this one. Little Saigon or the one over in china town even also called little siagon. more of the OC LS feel. I'm pretty glad I'm moving back on thursday, really miss good vietnamese food.
Good broth and excellent service. One of the best pho I have ever had. Spring rolls with pork was delicious.

Ordered beef pho to go. Was ready very quickly and very delicious when I got home :)
This is my favorite pho place they give you a lot of meet in the soup and it doesn't have a lot of fat, also thin slices. Overall 5 stars, the service was fast and easy, they were nice and the place looked clean

What's there to say they are great. Never had to wait that long from ordering to the end . love the pho best in town . will continue to enjoy there service and awesome food and dining. They are also very clean.
So we come here at least 2-3 times a week. My girlfriend and my son loves this place and we really enjoy the food consistently. Best Pho place in Las Vegas/ Henderson area.

The food is incredible. Best Vietnamese restaurant I have been to outside of San Francisco. Everything is fresh and the portions are generous. My favorite is the #12 and the vegetarian spring rolls. 

The service is fantastic. The manager came over and helped us decide what to order. 

Go here!!!!
Very good food. I will definitely be back here when I'm in the mood for soup and noodles. Great location.

Couldn't give it a 4.5 so I gave it a 4. Of the Vietnamese food on this side of town their Phó was the heartiest ... most meat and veggies. Although,  you do pay a little more for that benefit. Pho done right is hard to mess up. They do it right.  Good attentive service.  I may be a little "westernized"/ "Europeanized" but I was a little disappointed that they didn't offer banh mi sandwiches.  But you can get just french bread. I also enjoyed the pork roles. 
 
Good little spot.
The food was tasty, and the service great!!  Very attentive and friendly, and cheaper than pho Kim long.  Overall a great experience.
Great broth! Very authentic with a ton of flavor! Great Thai tea as well. Service is fast and attentive. Usually busy but haven't yet had a problem being seated right away!
The pho is ok. It's good but it's pho. The service brings this place down quite a bit. I'm not too picky but I don't like having to get up to find my server 3 times a meal.
Quick and friendly service! If you love spicy food, order #73 and add extra spicy paste they give you! Its really good! But I do wish that the bowls were bigger!
SUCH GOOD PHO! But the service and atmosphere sucks, so I only get take out. I get the #11 every time! So good.

Best Pho I've found in Vegas.

The place is fairly nice for a Henderson strip mall. Decor is appropriate and tasteful, you'd have friends and family here; unlike most Pho joints that feel like a Vietnamese Robertos. Not that there's anything wrong with Robertos, it's just not a place you'd take a hot date. Saigon 8 is. Actually,  a "best I can get right now" date or "I'm feeling fat/unemployed" kinda date, but regardless, you won't be ashamed of this place.

The Pho is excellent. Standard pho gringo rules apply with Pho, stick with the Pho tai until you know what you're dealing with. Tripe is not for the unfamiliar stomach.  One amazing thing they do here that's apparently illegal in Vietnam: the veggie pho actually features veggie broth, and IT'S MARKED ON THE CONTAINER.

Also a fun game we play every time I call:
I say: "Hi can I have a Pho Tai and a Veggie Pho please? Extra meat and extra Jalapenos"
They say: "(Vocal Noises sounding mildly like english that may or may not be confirming my order.)"
"I didn't catch that, was that a Pho Tai and a Veggie Pho"
"(Garbles that may be English with incomprehensible accent)... 10 minutes".
"Okay thanks"

And my order has always been right over 10+ visits. Always extra Jalapenos, always extra meat, never any missing sides. This impresses me more than anything else.
Sorry. Just not my kind of Pho. The service was lousy, we waited almost 25 minutes for a bowl of soup. ?!?!
Really enjoy this place. This is my choice for best Pho spot in Vegas. Far better than the incredibly overrated Pho Kim Long on Spring Mt

Korean noodles served up cheap and fast across from LVAC and BodyHeat. What more could you ask for? The perfect amount of spice in the BBQ pork meatballs and noodles, and if there isn't, there's always sriracha or chili paste. 

This place has an enormous menu for the trying, but the first thing I wanted, they were out of. Credit card minimum of $10 so make sure to bring cash.
I dont really know much about pho, but i thought whatever i ordered was really good. the service kinda sucked though.

I'd been wanting some Pho for some time and decided to stop one afternoon to kill my craving. The seating was a bit crowded, they were very busy and it was somewhat loud with the boisterous conversations but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Even though it was busy service was fast and efficient. I ordered the #44 Hu Tieu hay Mi Tom Cua (noodle soup with shrimp, crab and egg) and was not disappointed. I garnished it with the bean sprouts, basil and jalapeno along with some extra sauce to give it a bit more kick and paired it with some warm sake. I took my time enjoying the flavors as well as the atmosphere. I haven't tired many Vietnamese restaurants so I am by no means a  connoisseur but I will say I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch.

I love love love this place!  I practically eat here almost once a week.  Coming from a city where there was a lot of yummy Vietnamese food readily available, I was determined to find something similar in Henderson.  Pho Saigon 8 has come the closest to any I have tried...and trust me, I have tried many. 

My latest favorite crave here is the beef stew with wide flat noodles!  One thing I looooveeee about the soup is that you can taste the richness of the soup, meaning it took many hours to make it into its thick tendinous consistency, which is very hard to find in today's American money hungry culture!  (Less quality, more quantity).  ;-) 

But if you are a "Hendersonian" and is craving Vietnamese food, I'd suggest you to stop by Pho Saigon 8, right next to the LVAC on Eastern!

I have to agree with many of the reviews about this restaurant. Pho is great and love the spring rolls . Unfortunately everything other than the food is not impressive. I have been there several times (because I enjoy the food) and feel the same way about service not rude but very distant, ready for clean up and new customer to sit.
Food
Service 
Clean

I think this is the best Pho place I have eaten at so far in Vegas.

I had the #1 egg rolls, and the lettuce and herbs were fresh cold and crunchy, while the egg roll was hot and crispy, wrapping the egg roll in lettuce and herbs and dipping in the sweet fish sauce provided a wide variety of delicious flavors and textures.

I also had the # 24 beef Pho that had a great beef broth, a generous serving of noodles, and was unusually hearty for a serving of Pho, though I did get the large.

My companion had the #76 which was a combo of many different things in the Pho, she has had more Pho from many more places and she said it was great.

The service was a little below average, come for the food, not for the service.  That's why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars.  I had to ask for a refill of my water multiple times.

Gave up with this place. My favorite dish here was beef stew. It was fine in the past until last two times I ordered from them. They got the cheapest and toughest beef that I've ever had. 1st time I let it go and thought maybe there was something wrong with their inventory. But this is the 2nd time I got this kind of beef means they decided to lower their meat quality. Will never come back.

What will it take to get this place to realize this is Vegas, you as a restaurant, survive on customer service!! Get it together, the waiter so so but Lordy the woman at the register was a Bitch. Never again will I give them my money

There are other pho places close by but I really like it here.
The service is quick and inexpensive.I t's very convenient when you want something quick and not terribly unhealthy after going to the gym.

I always order the combination pho.  I think they brought everything out in less than 5 minutes.  Maybe I've eaten a lot of pho my whole life and I cannot tell "good" from "great" anymore, but I come here every time because of proximity to the starbux, gym, and my appartment.  They have a nice selection of rice dishes too.  

Interestingly, they don't bring the check. You have to go to the cashier to pay, so remember your table.

Can't go wrong with the Bun Bo Hue with a lot of meat in it.  The dishes here are good but pricier than the Vietnamese restaurant in China town.  This restaurant locate in Henderson very convenient therefore you have to pay for the location but still fair.  They also serve fresh coconut juice for $4.95 per coconut.

Their food is good and all especially their spring rolls but their service is horrid.

I may be the annoying customer that disliked where they seated me and asked to move but 1) it was right after they set waters down not like there was tons of food placed yet and 2) if their dining area wasn't so cramped and dark then the corner right next to the kitchen would have been okay.

And I may not have understood that Thai iced tea was not the same as their regular iced tea because the person who usually takes me there and orders for me was not there this time. And of course, I have to send the Thai iced tea back even though I had described to the male waiter that I wanted the "clear" iced tea.

But for the staff to so rudely express their exasperation with me was not just humiliating to me in front of the person I brought to THEIR restaurant but also very frustrating as a paying customer. The waiter who brought me the tea I ordered wrong literally argued with me that it was what I ordered and though I apologized and explained what I wanted, he stormed off to the front counter with it and threw his as about yelling the story to the other two waiters, one of whom always grunts and groans when you ask her for anything.

And yet I never did get the right tea until after my food came and I had to ask the youngest waiter there who is very nice and cordial. 

I don't care how good their food is, I don't pay them to get treated like an unworthy peasant while families of six or seven get star treatment from these despicable two servers. Will not be returning simply because they are so unpleasant to even order from and the girl is just there to text on her cellphone in between acting bothered by customers. Pathetic.

It's hard for me to find a different pho place besides this one. I love this place, not only because of their food and warm delicious bowls of grilled shrimp vermicelli, or soup with the greatest rare steaks, but also because this place is so clean. The dishes and the small little sauce bowls are clean, their chopsticks are probably the best disposable chopsticks I've ever seen at a pho place, and the spoons are also clean. Seriously, go here just simply because.

I live by little Saigon in southern California and we always come here when we're in Vegas. They have friendly staff and their food is great. I always order the bun bo hue. It's spicy and loaded with meat! The pho is great as well. They don't disappoint.

Had fresh roll. A little bland and dry. The Pho w beef brisket and ribeye was decent. Broth had decent flavor and portion size was well worth the $10. Service was very quick to deliver the food and slow to deliver the check. I think some people's complaints about rude service may be a misunderstanding of the culture and also due to a language barrier. But who knows. It's not overly friendly there but it's a strip mall restaurant and they're busy. I went in to eat and I got hot, decent food so I'm happy. If you're looking for a dinning experience that's going to change your life this isn't the place. If your looking for a decent and hot meal at a fair price then this is it. Definitely will be back. Only 4 stars because I've had better Pho but it's still good and well worth the price.

The people here are so nice and welcoming! My mother, sister, and I were seated right away. The broth was delicious and the cilantro and green onions added a amazing scent. Everything was cooked perfectly. I know I will be back!

"I`m Pho-king hungry!" I make this joke anytime I know Pho is on the schedule for the day. Then I laugh. Then it's awkward. 

Anyway, I came here with my friend yesterday for some Pho. This is her normal spot and my first time here. I set one foot in the door the the lady had two menus in her hand already and asked "Two?". Yes, but when did you even see us?! Whatever. We were seated IMMEDIATELY is what I`m getting at here and that was just fine with me. We were brought water twice(as in TWO glasses of water EACH), which was a little odd, but I figured they just didn`t want to fuss with refilling our water? Who knows. I didn`t care much about that oddity. Within about 3 minutes they came to take our order and luckily, I always know what I want. Gimmie the Pho, number 11, the one with the rare cow that cooks in the broth. You know.  Also, a Sapporo, please and thanks. 

They brought my cold beer out pretty quickly but the glass wasn't cold(I know, I know. I like fancy touches, but still.) Sapporo as expected. Pho came out pretty soon after that with all the sides. I got a small and it was still pretty large. I love Pho and the bang for your buck that you get. Big bowl of broth, noodles(LOTS of noodles at this particular place), and some meat. I will say that there wasn't enough meat to satisfy my little carnivore heart, but it is what it is. The broth was AMAZING, which more than made up for the lack of meat. Add some lime to that bowl of broth = totally drinkable. So good! Some of the best Pho broth I have ever had. Noodles were..noodles. Overall, I would come back here. I found the service to be okay. They didn`t offer me another beer which was a little sad, but also helped me minimize my day drinking.

First time I went here last month, I thought this place was okay. They gave me too much noodles in the soup that I was overwhelmed. 

Second time, I LOVE IT. 

My boyfriend got the Pho Tai (rare steak pho) and the broth was perfect. My grandma was impressed with how clear the broth was (listen to the old asian lady, they know what they are talking about when it comes to pho!). I liked how it was not too salty but still flavorful.

I got the Bo Luc Lac Rice (shaken beef). The beef was tender and they did not drown it in sauce like some places do. The lady  recommended steamed rice but I opted for their red rice (i think it's tomatoes that makes it red...but I am not sure). Next time, I will do the steamed rice. 

Thai tea was amazing! Some places, the thai tea is too sweet. I can still taste the tea at this place. 

Service was nice. I liked that they refilled my water so much. Great selection of food. Will be back.

Foods pretty awesome.
Atmosphere is claustrophobic inducing though.
Combination Meat pho is lacking exotic meats though. Mostly just flank steak

Noodles cold and hot are great at this place!!! I tend to take anyone who loves noodles to this place. My kids love the noodles and we eat at this place atleast once a week. Fast service but the customer service could be more personable and friendly but other than that the food is awesome!!!

My boyfriend and I were hesitant on going here at first since they have branches all around town. We like local owned restaurants instead. We were nearby and needed something quick so we gave it a try. My boyfriend loved the broth. He usually doesn't care much for pho. It does taste different from all of the other pho places we've tried in town. Definitely coming back here, hopefully when it's not too crowded. (It can get really crowded)
My boyfriend and I look forward to eating here every time we crave Pho, it's definitely our go to. They're knowledgeable and speedy! Love it!

Food was pretty good. Portions were nice size as well. I only put 4 stars because I asked for no bean sprouts and they forgot I told them that. I just picked them out. 
Other than that they were nice and good service.

I have had Pho just a few times.  Have to say, this place is pretty good.  I had the Pho Chicken Breast and Thigh.  Thick pieces of chicken, tasty, spicy, and price was decent.  Place is located in a pretty busy strip mall right off the 215.  Around lunch time, parking can get tough, but immediately after 2 pm it opens up.  The restaurant is a bit small and since it can get busy, you will feel a littled cramped. Still worth it since the food is good and staff is great.

The only good thing about this restaurant is the food. Other than that, I would never have a reason to come back. The service, timing of the food and attentiveness is terrible. The server never brought my drink. I received my appetizer and dinner 30 seconds apart. Dinner was cold by the time I got to it. I couldn't get napkins or a refill on water.

Its as good as it gets for Henderson.....lots of way better Pho places in Cali but I live in Vegas and this is as good as it gets for me until the next time my mama comes out and makes her Pho it at my house!

I always have the same thing...Hu tieu wonton, Pho Tai, Pho Ap Chao..
always good..nice clear broth, good flavor and they don't skimp on stuff like other places.
I did try the Bun Cha Hanoi once, big mistake...my mom makes the BEST bun cha hanoi so I thought I'd try theirs...well the skewered pork was tasty but the patties were awful!  There was no flavor to it what so ever!! Too bad, I was really hoping to enjoy that since my mom only comes out every few months to make her version of what my friends call "Lei Mama Patties". Oh well, c'est la vie...
I still love this place either way and am here at least once a month!

To all the people who say I should expect bad service because it is a Vietnamese restaurant, I'm sorry you feel that way. If I walk into a place to spend money, I shouldn't feel like a jerk for inconveniencing them. If you hate your job, quit. I work in a restaurant, too, and I know we all have bad days, but nobody should feel unwelcome when they want to spend their money and enjoy lunch. To put it shortly, the service was awful. We walked in and were sat, and before our menus were open the giant guy who sat us was already asking if we were ready. Not yet, guy. So he walks away, does a loop around the tiny restaurant, and 30 seconds later asks if we are ready. Repeat twice. Then, he got annoyed, sneezed into his hand, and never came back (thank goodness.) 

When we did finally order, I got Veggie spring rolls and bun with egg rolls. Spring rolls were yummy, no complaint there. My noodles though... soggy lettuce and warm noodles, eek.

My boyfriend ordered a pork stew over egg noodles, but what he got was gigantic chunks of pork fat. That's just gross. I took a picture of the scooped out fat... probably about 8 oz of fat and 3 oz of actual pork meat. I think most would agree that less quantity and more quality is preferable to more waste and less quality. When my food lovin' non-picky eater of a boyfriend barely touches a meal, there's an issue. Even he was grossed out by the bad quality.

I'll just keep going to Pho Kim Long in China Town. It's a longer drive, but at least I didn't get treated like I kicked someone's pet as soon as I walked in, and the food is fresh and yummy.

Very good pho. Reasonable and fast. I comes to this location often but my last experienced was disappointing as they died not haver limes and there Broth did not seem as flavoursome as usual. I'm hoping this was a once off and will try again.

The wife and I have been coming here for over a year. When we first went the service was very good, friendly, and it felt like our business was appreciated. I don't know what happened but....

Out of the last three times we came the waiter (the same one each time) didn't take our drink orders, was very impatient while we were ordering, and my wife had to chase down a different waiter for water. FYI, all three times the waiter was that fat one that another reviewer found very rude/short. Speaking about the wait staff, did someone scare off all the female employees?

The strangest part is that food is exactly the same: fantastic. I wish Yelp would let us differentiate between the food, place, and staff as the food would easily get 5 stars while the staff (well, that staff that's left) would get 1.

It's very rare that I'd let the wait staff get to me as usually a return visit gets me a different waiter, but this place is so small that's not an option. Right now I'll just resign myself to finding a different Pho place.

Was going here regularly until we discovered they weren't using veggie broth. Great soup honestly. Some of the best we've had in Vegas but we can't eat here anymore because we can't have animal broth.

It's ok but taste watery no flavor not really impressive. Service not all that .
Will not come back here .

These guys are great for quick service! if you feel like take out or dine in, they will definitely get your order out quick and efficiently! Their tai tea is on point and is always a smart pick if you've got a sweet tooth like myself! I always order from there when I'm in need of something to fill me up and fast!
My Favorite PHO place outside CHina Town, super cheap and tastes great even with take-out!

It's convenient, they have vegetarian pho and really good tofu spring rolls.   
The service range from efficient to retarded (just one guy who must be high cause or dropped as a kid)

Everyone is nice except the guy with the mustache who works there who had a death stare match with me.

(I won by the way)

Best pho place in town. I usually get the Pho Tai or the rice plate with the cubed beef. Their pho soup is really good. I'm not sure what makes their soup so much better then the other Vietnamese restaurants, but this place always hits the spot. Egg rolls and spring rolls taste very good here as well! I recommend going to this restaurant simply because the food is amazing. Customer service is above average as well. Unless they are full, they pretty much seat you right away.
Great Pho, loved it! Had a great time with a buddy who also thought it was great. will visit again soon I home!

When I lived in Vegas, this was my go-to place for a good bowl of pho. I lived alone at the time, so I rarely ever cooked pho at home since a pot of it can feed a dozen people. Vietnamese food has come a long way since I moved there in 2006. Pho Saigon 8 is one of the best in town. The broth is clear and flavorful, made with just the right amount of each ingredient. Some places botch the soup by adding too much of a certain ingredient. Clarity is a good indication of the quality of a pho broth. If it's cloudy, it's probably no bueno. 

Besides the pho, the other dish I usually order here is the Hu Tieu My Tho with the soup on the side. I love Hu Tieu, probably even more than Pho, and this place has the best in town. Nothing compared to my hometown favorites (Nam Vang & Da Lat), but it's the best thing I can eat when I am not at home. For those who don't know, Hu Tieu is another variation of Pho. It comes with noodles and meat. I prefer to keep the broth separated and eat the noodles dry. I sip the broth with each bite and it's quite a delicious way to eat noodles.

So we went to take my sister for Pho for her birthday, and yes this was a highly recommended. We arrived and were told it would be a 10 minute wait for our party of six. About 25-30 minutes we watch them seat a party of 5 that came in after us. We spoke up before they were seated and the staff did not make it right, so we walked out with a very loud voiced opinion. We will NEVER I mean NEVER return and the business owners that recommended this place will be told. I'd also give less than a star if possible.

When my parents first moved to Las Vegas, they asked the cashier at our pizza place (shout out to Eighth Avenue Pizza in Southern Highlands) where he goes for pho. He was Vietnamese and they assumed he would know where to go. He recommended this joint and that was 5 years ago. This has become one of our favorite places to eat out. Get past the language barrier. The menu (as I have photographed) has plenty of pictures with good descriptions of the food. We pretty much get the same thing everytime: 2 orders of spring rolls (they come 2/order); large pho #18, which has everything- rare eye of round, flank, brisket, tendon, & tripe; and #78, crispy egg noodles with stir-fried chicken, seafood. quail eggs, and vegetables. Sometimes, I order #61, grilled slice beef with rice vermicelli. The food comes out quick and is delicious. The wait staff is hit or miss, which is why I docked them a star. The prices are reasonable- pretty much everything is less than $10. The portions are large. We always end up bringing home our lunch and have it for dinner, too. For $1.85, you can order an extra portion of soup broth to add to the leftover pho. We always enjoy our lunch here. We go early, around 11, because they do get busy closer to noon.
Really good Pho! The Spring  Rolls were really good as a starter and you get plenty of food for the price. Nothing fancy but just good Pho.
I ordered the seafood pho for pick up! The gentleman was very nice and the food was delicious.

This is my usual go to pho place close to home. The restaurant is clean, they get you seated quickly and the portions are fair. Make sure you take note that the pho prices on their menu are for the "large" bowl but by default they give you the regular size if you don't ask. 

They have the best taste and value fresh spring rolls (they have pork and shrimp inside) I've had so far in Vegas. Seems so simple but yet other places can't seem to pull it off.

This place is pretty much a get in, eat, get out and get on with your life type of business. The service interaction is fairly minimal (which I actually like in some situations) so don't expect any small talk. They bring you some water, take your order, bring your food and you pay yourself at the counter when you're ready. If you need something else just flag them down and they'll help you. It helps if you know your table number which is labeled but they generally know which table is yours.

Your best bet is to do your homework on what dishes you may want to try, then go in and order by number.

If you're into really thick and strong coffee, give the Vietnamese ice coffee a try. I'll try to post a video of it brewing - it takes quite some time to funnel its way down into the glass so you can dump it in your ice but it's worth the wait.

My biggest beef with Pho Saigon 8 is that their Spring Mountain location is subpar and inconsistent in food taste/quality.  I will however visit this location any day of the week.

PS- if you like pork chops marinated in fish sauce and grilled.. It's absolutely wonderful here. Another popular item is any of the bún - rice noodle (no soup) dishes. Be sure to try it with the sweet chili sauce!

I'm from the bay area and have tried beef stew noodle soup all over the area and since moving to Vegas, I needed my pho phix!  Thanks yelpers, for helping me find this place!  They make one of the best that I have tasted.  The broth is delicious and the beef meat to tendon ratio is great.  I will be back to try other dishes as well.

They do have other food here...
But I keep coming back for the Phò.
It has always been outstanding.

Made to order, fresh, hot and served by friendly staff.
Food is good...but the service is just not up to Par.  They need to be a little bit more organized.

This Pho restaurant is ok if you are not able to go to CHina Town.  They are often crowded and the tables are too close together.

The Pho is pretty good and so is the BBQ chicken rice plate.  That sauce to dip the chicken in GOOD!

We go there when we dont want to drive to far.

NEVER coming back to eat here!!!
Hope the $13.75 is worth my monthly business and a bad review. 

Told her I wanted Phô Xâo Dón Thâp Câm which I've had at different Vietnamese restaurant. She pointed at #79-Phô Áp Châo Thâp Cám. I asked specifically if noodles are flat and cut in squares. She mutters, "It's same..same thing". Okay I'll get it. 10minutes later guy comes and drops it off at table and leaves. I waved at guy to tell him it's not the same noodles that I wanted. He said, u ordered #79! Yes but only bc she said it was same thing....And it's not! He then tried to explain that every place makes it different. Okay I understand that so don't tell me it's same thing if it's NOT, right? Well immediately I said, "can I see the menu I want something else."!He continues trying to explain and wasn't taking it off my bill bc "I ordered it". I finally said fine do whatever charge me but I don't want it.  I ordered #70. It was okay(5.5/10), definitely had better at other places. 
Now that I've read few other 1star reviews on here, 200% I will NOT ever eat here!!! It was on dirty dining for demerits, Yelper witnessed employees not washing hands, Yelper had hair and bug found in their food! Plus you raised the prices on menu I noticed. 

Here's my $13.75 of advertising for u!!!

Close to the house, I frequent this restaurant when in need for something not super heavy to eat.  Overall it is one of the better Vietnamese restaurants around my neighborhood.  It actually gets pretty busy at times since it's in the LVAC parking lot.  A fair amount of seating, but we usually get take out.  Check your order though because we have on multiple occasions received the wrong order, and let's just say they were annoyed with us and claimed we got it wrong.

We always get their fresh spring rolls, and they provide a generous amount of peanut hoison dipping sauce in the to go order.  The rolls are also fairly sizable.  Not the best I have ever had, but consistent and hit the spot.

I get the vermicelli noodles with the grilled pork.  However I always get it to eat the next day because they always cook their noodles to long, and they firm up over night.  The pork is flavorful and tender, but the naoc mam (fish sauce) is fairly basic. I wish they used more herbs, garlic, shallots etc to add some extra punch to their noodle bowls.

My boyfriend appreciates that they have the Vietnamese rice porridge (chao) on request, but I prefer his mothers.  This one doesn't have that much of a flavor to me, and I get bored eating it quickly.  He also prefers their pho here above a lot of places in the valley.  They give a large amount of basil and and limes on the side unlike some places.  He always gets the combo.

They have some good jelly desserts that are tasty, a bit sweet, but less sweet than a lot of other restaurants.

They are a good spot when you don't feel like driving further into China town. Although I don't feel I have been to a Vietnamese spot in Las Vegas that has totally blown my mind yet, despite the many selections that have been popping up.

The best pho in town !  I used to go to their Springmountain location , so it's the same menu.   Same foods , but with better service.  Eric, the manager, used to work at the other location, is always friendly.   I usually get the #15 , meatballs and rare eye round steak.  The beef stew w/ french bread is delicious too.  My girl recently ordered combo fried rice and now it's her usual outside of ordering pho.  It's got a great flavor with bits of chinese sausage thrown in .
      Their competitor : Lemongrass- pho :  broth is bland ,  very little meat

I'm so irritated by this place. I was told about it by family and thought I would give it a try. I was sat promptly for just myself. I totally understand at these places especially for a party of one if your at a large table other party's are sat with you. The family that was sat at the same table had a young child with the loudest Ipad ever on. After five minutes and no servers coming by I got up and decided to order to go.

I ordered a chicken pho, egg rolls, a roll of French bread and Thai iced tea. When he told me the total I almost said never mind but I'm really hungry and craving soup. Fine f*** it I'll pay the !!!!!$21 dollar!!!!! bill.
I've never paid so much for literally the same meal I get every time I go to a pho place. That's how much it usually costs for two meals! 

So I sit down to wait....and wait......and wait. It's been 30 minutes from the time I ordered to go. I'm about ready to say never mind I want my money back. Me and another guy get up and are looking at the dude in the front like ughhhhh hello! He goes into the back and brings out 5 to go orders! Are you freaking kidding me?!?! So my order was just sitting back there?! When I ask for my Thai iced tea he grabs it out of the fridge with a bunch of melted ice in it. So that was probably sitting there for 30 minutes also. I got it home and it was just warm not hot like it should be. Egg rolls were soggy. Not crispy crunchy. So disappointed 

Food was just ok. Not any better than any other place. Not terrible. Just whatever. 

Also it was totally silent in there. Like no music. It was awkward no ambiance or vibe. 

NEVER GOING HERE AGIAN. I should have just gone to a place I had been before.

Delicious chicken breast pho, Scrumptious delicious appetizers, no crazy hovering from the servers and an efficient checkout process with the cashier. Who could ask for more?. Plus the broth is the bomb!

I've been here several times now and I think it's a pretty decent place overall. 

I really like their egg rolls and spring rolls. Both are yummy and the portions are decent for the price. The sauce that comes with both is really good.
