I usually get the pho with chicken and that is my favorite option here. Today I had the pho with beef and I didn't like the beef as much as the chicken. The amount of meat in all of the pho options is generous. My husband was on the fence about giving pho a try, but changed his mind when he saw how much meat comes in the bowl. The small bowl is a lot of food and I can't imagine who would be able to eat the large. I like that they bring out items to help customize your dish like bean sprouts, basil, lime, chili paste, and jalapenos. I love adding jalapenos and chili paste for a spicy dish.

The restaurant seems clean. The service isn't anything notable, but it isn't bad either. The food comes out quickly and drinks get refilled before you need to ask. I like the check out process as well. When you are finished you just go to the counter, give them your table number (a sticker on the turntable at each table), and they give you your total.

This is a great little place after the gym or for lunch. It is healthy and good for your diet, but also quick and good for your budget. Plus, pho makes you feel good in general. If you have a short lunch break, this place is great. I think this is the best pho place in town.

Food was good. Unfortunately the servers act like they don't want to be there. And when you ask for a to-go container, you get an eye roll. Not even a thank you or have a good day. Sad because I liked the food.

I've been to Pho Saigon 8 multiple times; there are a few pros and cons for me.

Pros:
- Generous portions of Pho for low prices
- Delicious, hearty broth; one of the better broths out of the Pho restaurants I've been to
- Delicious Vietnamese fried egg rolls and rice paper spring rolls
- Fast service 

Cons:
- Brisket is the only meat I ever order in my Pho and the brisket here is way too fatty. Each slice of brisket is over 50% fat. There's different kinds of fatty too but this one is ridiculously chewy. I spend more time dissecting my brisket than enjoying my soup. 
- Sometimes the bean sprouts they bring out for your Pho looks and tastes old and withered

Anyway, the broth is amazing. If you order your pho and get meatballs, flank steak, rare beef, etc. I would definitely recommend coming here. If you like brisket though, try Pho Little Siagon across the street. Such tender beef brisket!

Best chain pho restaurant in Vegas. Taste is closest to Home. This Eastern location is smaller and has a limited menu compared to the Spring Mountain location. -1 star because they don't have fresh squeezed orange juice or soy milk, 2 items I always look forward to at Spring Mtn location.

I have been to this place about 3 times now.  Place is almost always packed.  Food is great and service can improve.  It is good place to go for 1.5hrs lunches.  :) 

Fresh rolls are awesome here and so is the beef stew!
Everytime I come here service is superb, food is great, location is near my home. When they get busy is when space is extremely limited.  Overall rating is 4 stars

There is an extensive selection of Vietnamese dishes here, including different types of pho for cheap prices.  I was able to stop in here for a fresh, tasty bowl of beef pho with tender rare steak and a Vietnamese ice coffee on my way to the airport.  

As opposed to the bay area, this place is much nicer than the average pho joint where I'm from.  The furniture here is a rich chocolate brown color including the walls where matchstick bamboo roll up shades hang over the windows.  The table tops on dark wooden legs are a sturdy granite with green and brown shades.  Even the chairs are  unique with routered silhouettes of bowls of pho with chopsticks on the wooden seat back of each chair.  There is a nice selection of dark green foliage inside giving the restaurant somewhat of an exotic feel.

The service here is also attentive, friendly and good.  They will clear your table as dishes become empty unlike the average pho spot which waits until you're completely finished.

I love this place!  I always get the #12 large size and it's always fresh and delicious.  Really good broth, and the meat is sliced super thin and they give you a lot!  The noodles are on point too.  My order is always to my table in like 5 mins, and my water glass is never empty, just make it visible on your table cuz they can get really busy.  If you want a nice hot filling meal, come here.  I live close, so it's my go-to pho spot.

I appreciate good pho, but I rarely stray from the "safe stuff".  This place is pretty go-to when I'm looking for some hot soup and some fresh spring rolls.  I haven't tried any of the non-pho stuff, to be honest.

This place seems like it is always busy, but there are always tables opening up.  The staff works pretty quickly to get things cleaned up and usher in new customers.

Good and fast.  Pho was hot and well spiced.  Lean meat, no fat.  Grilled beef was very good.  
Had kids with us.  Nice fast dinner.

Best Pho I've ever had!  I've eaten here weekly for a few years.  Large 22 cures any ailment!  Always great fresh sides for the soup.  Best iced tea in town.  It's got Jasmine and a ton of other flavors I love, but can't name.  Their fresh French bread is to die for along with their always crispy, piping hot egg rolls.
Love the Pho at this place.  I typically get the shrimp and crab in pork broth.  I love the location since it is right by my house, and the prices cannot be beat.

Fast review for a fast restaurant!

 REALLY FAST FOOD! But good quality.

Veggie Pho has really good cooked veggies including Bok Choy. They are always friendly and have good service. Price is great and I know when I in a hurry I can still eat well. Please check them out!

Pretty good spot to get your pho fix.

Environment: similar to most Vietnamese restaurant, most people come here for a quick lunch or dinner. 

Service: most of the workers are Vietnamese. I wouldn't say they are super friendly, but they get the job done. We sat down quickly, they got our orders fast and brought our food out quickly. You then pay at the front cashier before you leave.

Food: the food here is pretty good. I got the spring rolls which taste good especially with their peanut sauce. I get the pho special with the tendons tripe and flank beef. Because I was really craving pho, i really enjoyed it. The broth was delicious and the meat was good as well. They also give you the standard sprouts, mint leaves, lime, and jalapeños. 

Overall, good spot to get your pho fix. It is in a convenient location, and you can eat quickly and get back to your business after.

Really REALLY good.
Ordered the Pork flavored pho and it was delish. The broth was one of the best broths i've had. Service was super quick and to top of the great meal the soundtrack they had playing was some super old school pop and it was awesome. Can't wait to go back!
Poor service in this resto. Wait staff looks like they don't want your business and cashier is texting. Food is decent just needs better service

Pho was good (broth was lighter per previous reviewer's comments).  Prices were reasonable.  Restaurant was very clean and service was a-ok.  I have nothing bad to say about it.  

Also, @Matthew C: though I've been known to have a similar opinion about LV residents' tastes, I thinks it's super positive to see restaurants opening that are not KFCs / Taco Bells.  I like to support any independent business trying to make it.
We are here every week because we absolutely love this place. Affordable price, big serving, good tasting food.

Always a great place for some pho.  Service is fast and polite and the food is not greasy.  The eggs rolls and spring rolls are fresh and the rice dishes are always so delicious! The price is reasonable and definitely worth it. I've been to a lot of pho places and this makes it to the top!

We have dined at this location several times when it was originally occupied by Bon Jour Bistro and most recently by the American Grill.  We shared orders of Pho ga tang (chicken noodle soup served with cilantro, basil, bean sprouts, jalapeno and hoisin sauce) and cha gio (crisp spring rolls that you wrap in a piece of lettuce and dip in nuoc cham (Vietnamese dipping sauce)).  The basil was not fresh so I requested more and got what I asked for, more un-fresh basil.  The flavor of the pho was mild and the chicken was limited to a few shreds.

Passing by this place to give it another try.. Not holding my hope up.. 

First thing walking into the restaurant, what's up with flickering lights? Are we in October hollowing hunted house already?
Don't like hunted restaurant!!

Services still poor, there are NO soup spoons on the table we were sitting at! I asked for it, of course, non came. I had to seek spoons from adjacent table! 

Then as we wait for waiter to get our orders, he expressed they had RUN out of basil for pho noodle soup!!! It is unheard of! Sounds like breakfast restaurant telling me they run of eggs and bacons at 06:00 AM as I just sit down in their restaurant.

Then we were out of cold water, I asked for more water. It only took 10 minutes for the water made it to our table after 8 other tables got their fresh water refilled!?!? WTF!?!?

Hunted restaurant!? No soup spoons, no waters, no basil for pho noodle soup!! Sorry, Pho Sai Gon 8 at Henderson, you fail again as customer services!

My go to pho spot. Broth is flavorful and consistent. My favorites are the pho with well done lean meat and the bbq pork rice dish.  I used to dine here pretty often but lately I've been getting takeout. The soup is packaged very nicely and just as tasty as when we dine in.

I've been coming here for the past 2 years. It is a great little spot for a great bowl of pho. The food is really good and the staff is great as well. In addition, when I order to-go, the food is ready at a good rate, without flavor or quality compromise. Awesome food and awesome staff!

My boyfriend and I mistakenly ordered Pho from this location through a food delivery service and we noticed the difference in quality. We did not enjoy our dinner and the whole time he commented on how the broth didn't taste good and I had to agree. I tried to find positives but there went any. 

I'll stick to my local Pho restaurant that we frequent because we didn't like the food from this place.
Dependable and consistent. I love pho and eat it in every season so I'm glad I have a place that I can count on.
We love this place for both dine in and to go it is a little small but both my kids love their broth. You can truly tell a great pho house by the smell as you walk in.

im giving it a 4 because the bun bo hue is fucking great. thats the only reason why i go there. i bring my own bottled water cuz I know im not getting refilled. uhm. customer serive throw that shit out the door. and I'm not vietnamese but for all the yuppies out there thinking your gonna get great service from a vietnamese restaurant, you might want to think again. the pho. not very good at all. but what ever. i give it a 4 because i get what i want and its inexpensive.

I have been here twice and had the same grumpy old Asian man server both times. 
I knew I was in the right place when I was the only white guy in there. It is always busy so that says something.

The food is really delicious and such big portions. You are definitely full when you leave.

I decided to take the wife and kids to broaden their horizons. It was an experience watching them look at all the condiments like the basil, lime, jalapenos and sprouts and wondering how they were going to use them.

I had the chicken and seafood pho, it was just as delicious as the first time I had it, with perfectly cooked shrimp and quail eggs floating around for a great rich touch. The broth is so flavorful.

The kids all had the chicken pho. They weren't sure how to eat it. I told them slurping was OK, just in here though..lol

My wife unfortunately didn't eat anything because the old man either didn't understand her when she said vegetarian and asked if they had rice noodles. He kept showing her items on the menu with chicken and just didn't get it.  So that sucked

It was a great experience for the children and I stopped someplace after for the wife.

Service is basic is all I can say. He takes the order, and drops the check off when you are done.

Next time, I want to find a place that clearly says what vegetarian options they have so my wife can enjoy with us...

The perfect stop in LV to recover from the buffets on the strip. We always get one large bowl each, one with raw meat, briskest and meat balls that you can dip in hoisin sauce and one bowl with everything including the tendons. My husband is a white guy but in terms of Pho (minus the tendons) he's becoming a native and this is a compulsory stop in Vegas. The service is really fast, so that you can quickly dig in. On the plus side, look around you, plenty of Vietnamese people and this is always a good sign.

It's a nice little spot that I've taken a few friends to. 
Cant go wrong with a clean environment and fresh food ;)

Four stars because of the service....its a good thing i don't care about that..but only because it's expected from an Asian establishment...Other than that it's good Pho.  I alternate between three different soups depending on my mood..always good..Ive never not enjoyed my meal. The broth is good..not the best Ive had, but its good for when my personal favorite Lemongrass across the street is closed for remodeling. Booo. You won't be disappointed here. Its a good choice.
Will not be back. Absolutely horrible, rude service. I would've given 0 stars if it was an option. It's dumb they won't let you order a small portion for carry out too.

Service:. Fast and efficient.  

Food: decent.  Broth was good.  Way way too many noodles for my liking, but perhaps some like alot of noodles.  Next time, I'll request for not too much noodles, as it is suppose to be a soup, right?
Iced coffee is strong and on point.  :)

I wish they had chili flakes.  I like spicy food but I'm not into the siracha or chili paste as it is just way too much sodium but dry chili powder would compliment pho perfectly.  Hard to find spots with it. Maybe I should travel with my own stash. :p

Will try again.

Love the food. It's always great. Service is lack luster as soon as they have more than 5 customers but the food is so tasty that really it's not that bad. 

Pho is pretty basic but they have awesome rice plates!

UNBELIEVABLY RUDE SERVICE. If you want to be ignored completely for simple things such as water please eat here. If you want to call to ask a question and the person that answers yells at you please call here. Enough said. Can take my love of pho else where.

So far this is the best pho I have had in Henderson.
Was seated fast and the service was really efficient, no room for idle chit chatting but I am okay with that.
Pricing is pretty standard for the many pho places in town.
Broth was very good and the meat was tender.
No oxtail option which makes me sad, but maybe i just needed to look harder.
I didnt really need the spring rolls, but it gave me something else to compare with others.
Had a nice flavor as well.
Decor is nothing spectacular, but the place was clean.
Still have a couple others to hit before I can decide which is my favorite pho.

I come here during the summer when it's 118° just for their pho. Pho Saigon 8 has the best pho in Vegas.

I could sit and drink the broth all day long. The noodles are an added bonus. And a little siracha, a little sweet sauce, toss in some bean sprouts, basil and a few jalapeños and you're set. 

Very friendly wait staff, usually pretty quick with seating, getting drinks and taking your order. 

I don't know what I'm going to do when I move to LA!

I thought i was going to pho 8 for their crab udon soup but accidentally came here instead.  The crab udon soup was really good, thick broth and well seasoned.  Unfortunately their pho was only okay.  Broth was a little bit under seasoned and their rare beef was overcooked when it got to our table

Consistently efficient service, often getting our food within 5 minutes of ordering.  Our family really appreciates as well the consistently yumminess of the pho.

Personally, I get the vermicelli dish with grilled marinated pork and egg rolls.  I usually use just a bit of sriracha and this meal leaves me perfectly full as well as not walking away from dinner with a sluggish, food-coma type feeling.

Best pho place in Henderson and such a convenience being able to enjoy quality pho without having to drive all the way to Spring Mountain.

Food is good but no service at all ! 
Do not dine-in if you do not  like 
your dinner ruined by snotty and rude service. 
Every one seems miserable. I reapeat everyone.  
They forgot to bring my food out and when I asked I was 
did you order at all ? hey my companion is half way through
his I did not come to just sit and watch others eat their meals. 

I had to ask for everything twice as the first no one seems to care or 
pretended they do not understand ENGLISH.  
When finally done I asked for my check
and the waiter pointed  me to pay in the counter  
using our table number.  I told the register why no one could 
bring the check over and she rudely told me she could have brought it over if I asked her but hey why would I walk over all the 
to the front just to ask register to bring my check.  
After I paid she did not even gave me a receipt I had to ask for it. 

WILL NEVER GO BACK - I WOULD LIKE TO BE TREATED LIKE A HUMAN WHEN I PAY FOR MY DINNER !

The Pho here is pretty solid.  The service is fast and they are always nice.  I usually get the #14 small, which is the rare steak and tendon. YUM. This is a usual lunch spot for me and one of my dear friends.  She always orders a dish that is not Pho, surprisingly.  It's grilled lemongrass chicken with eggrolls served over noodles. It always looks amazing!

Their eggrolls and spring rolls are both delicious!  This is also close to my house so that's a huge plus.

This is a cool place to enjoy great noodles.

1.  Spring Rolls - Had the Vietnamese Spring rolls here and it was very tasty! The dipping sauce and taste was very nice.

2.  Pho - we had the chicken Pho and also a meat pho with brisket, flank,tendons. I thought the tendon was undercooked, yet it wasn't and it was delicious.

3.  Broth - I liked it very much. It was clear, and had a nice taste of beef with green onion. Very subtle to me.  After I got the tasted down, I did throw some chili sauce into it, so, that altered it afterwards.

4.  Ambiance and others - Very small and nice, always crowded, and it a place where parking can be a challenge due to the large LVAC in the same log.

5.  Service -The staff are all young and very service oriented. You pay at the cashier and I have no idea how they remember what everyone ordered to give you the bill, yet they do!

I do love to have soda and they serve soda here in a can which is not as tasty to me as fountain and this means you will have to pay for refills......

Check this place out!
Yum yum yum. This hits the spot when I need a pho fix. They make a great variety of things and they are all tasty

If you're not near chinatown, this place is a good replacement if:
You don't mind sitting on your neighbor's lap
Dirty tables in abundance
Service is slow, unfriendly, and sometimes wrong

But, it serves the purpose. Next to yogurtland so you can get a delightful treat afterwards.
A must for anyone looking for delicious Vietnamese Cuisine. Very affordable prices and they offer great variety in their menu. Great location, and service. My favorite: #21..Large! :-)
Pretty standard menu and good prices. Broth was good but nothing memorable. The decor and service is ok. More of a eat and leave place. Like most pho spots. Overall good food.

This used to be our fav Pho place, even if its out of the way for us in Henderson, clean and new shop. Sadly the service is just bad. There is a "bigger" gal that works behind the counter, and has the "shoot me now, I hate my job" attitude. There is one lady who does get customer service and does a good job taking care of customers, but she is not always there. The Pho broth is clean, not greasy, and the noodle + protein amount is generous.  Prices seem a tad higher than most places in the Valley, but I dont think we will be going much anymore.

Had the chicken pho, fresh spring rolls and Thai tea. Broth was very good. Not too cinnamony like most places. Minus one star for not having any sandwhiches. I was really craving for binh ma... Also they didn't have the garlic chili sauce. Not sure if its usual to not have it but back home in Hawaii, we had it everywhere.
The pho here is really really good, lot's of meat in my yummy pho!  super love the peanut sauce of the spring roll. Always expect a crowded lunch and dinner.

Ok-for those who have never tried Pho Noodle soup, you need to!  Pho soup eats like a meal.  They serve fresh coconuts to go with their soup, and all ingredients are fresh.  Prices are very fair, and highly recommend!

Another favorite Pho place. The food is delicious like all vietnamese places i normally order the fresh egg rolls , fried egg rolls and the pork and their latte.. love the food here its pretty good prcies is pretty cheap as well the only downside to the place is the staff is not as friendly as the other vietnamese places.. I would still recommend this place if you are near this place just dont expect good service..

The pho was GREAT!!!! The beef noodle soup my husband got was GREAT!!!! The service was decent. The food came out fast. The waiter was very dull, didn't smile but he tended to us quickly. In the corner in the front is where they kept the black tub to put dirty dishes. I didn't see any dishes in there (didn't really go close enough to see) but that didn't look very appealing. Nevertheless, I will continue coming here.

Officially my new favorite Pho restaurant. Pho Kim long is definitely on my favorites as well, these two restaurants are head to head. So if you near by and like pho this is a spot you wanna check out!

I have been there 2 times in one week. That's how yummy this place is. 
The reason I like this place so much is because it is much more tasty than other Vietnamese restaurants I've tried out. They have a large menu so you have much to choose from. I only had take out, so I'm not sure how the service is other than take out. Try this place out if you like Asian cuisine. Man, I'm hungry now just thinking about it.

I always find myself coming here whenever I'm hungry and want something that doesn't break the bank. I always say I'm going to try something new whenever I come, but I always end up getting the #31... chicken breast w/ rice noodles; You really can't go wrong with it. Lately they've been a little slow when it comes to taking my order but they never fail when it comes to bringing out the food quickly. I also highly recommend their fried rice... Just trust me, you'll looove it!! I've never gone to any other phô place and I'm honestly okay with that because this place just works for me! Lol. What I like about this location is that it's right across the street from the yoga studio I go to so its really convenient and the perfect place to come and grab a bite to eat after some hot yoga!

I've been here a few times before (years ago), and it was always good food and good service. 

Most recently, I had dinner here a few nights ago. We got here around 6 or 7pm on a Monday, there was no wait, it was fairly busy, got seated immediately. But a few minutes after that, the dinner crowd started to roll in. We got there in good timing. 

Interior still looks the same since I was last here. Nice, clean, asian decor. 

I am currently on a Slow Carb Diet (protein, veggies, legumes...at least 20 grams of protein at each meal) to sugar detox and reclaim my health. That day I felt sick, so this was the perfect place to go to that night. My usual yelp habit is to look through the tips and then the reviews. I'm so glad I scanned the reviews because I read Mel C.'s review mentioning Pho with Chicken Breast! Thanks Mel! I scanned the menu at the table as well, and that was the best option for me. I've been to a couple of other Pho restaurants and that's the first time I saw Pho with Chicken Breast on the menu! I was excited. 

There's a choice of a small or large bowl, I got the small. The small was a pretty good size, filled with more than enough noodles, broth and thick slices of chicken breast. There must have been 8-10 slices of chicken breast, which was more than I expected. Score! I can't imagine what the large would be. 

I usually enjoy the noodles, but this time around because I was sick and have been cutting carbs my stomach didn't do well with the noodles. I ate a few, but they were too much for me. The noodles were pretty thick as well.

Next time, I'll have to ask for no noodles and replace them with veggies. 

Oh by the way, you can also ask for egg noodles if you prefer. They had no problem switching to egg noodles with my friend's bowl. 

Service was quick! Our food was brought to us in about 5 minutes. 

Great service, no complaints and I will be back again!

As far as the food goes the pho is good. The broth is amazing. I've been all over this city and keep coming back here . I probably won't anymore because the customer service is lacking. Especially on the female side, the men are OK. The women seriously need to lose the attitudes. I don't know if it's a cultural thing but Wtf. Any who it's cheap. I guess I have to start searching for another spot. Food wise it's a four, but since service sucks it's an overall two . *** There is one nice waitress, she the youngest***

Synopsis : Customer service sucks/extremely rude/inattentive

My friend Matt brought me here for my first experience with Vietnamese food and it was delicious.  The service was great.  I was apprehensive at first going somewhere that was out of my element, but a couple minutes later I was happy to be there.  Food tasted fresh, hot and so yummy.  I loved it so much I took my mom.  She polished off her bowl before I did!
I can't wait to go back again.  Now who should I take, hmm?

Felt like another run of the mill Pho spots that's on any other corner. I ordered the #11 because I just like it simple sometimes with just the beef in my pho. The table we got sat to had a strong scent of mildew. Maybe it's from the rags they keep using.. but that's just a guess so it could be something else. 

The Pho tasted okay so I will give it 4 stars.. but didn't really make me scream wow. The noodle was cooked well. 

The place is a little cramped so make sure you don't bump into anybody on the way in and out.

Wow they are getting a bad rep, the pho is actually good here. This stuff does not deserve thier 2.5 rating. 

I will agree not the best I have had but still good and definately worth going back. 

Tried a few things and the Bun Bo hue was hit and miss, first time soup was bland second time it was great. 

Service is usually bad but with most asian places its the norm, asian people go for the food not the service. 

One thing that was really good is the Nem (forgot the second word), ifs the pink meatballs that are not cooked (I think) with the raw garlic and chili in it. They serve it over vermacilli in one of thier bun dishes... that was good but only if you know vietnamese food. Bun bo Hue and raw Nem is not for the first timers. 

I would return again.

I was never a fan of Vietnamese food.  The first time I ever ate it was over ten years ago and thought to myself how I'd never eat it again.  I met my ex from Seattle and moved there for about almost 4 years and everywhere I went was a Pho restaurant.  After a while I came to fall in love with their food and only in Seattle.  I swore that there would never be another Vietnamese restaurant that can compare.

Today, mom decided she wanted to eat Vietnamese and thought what the heck.  I drove on Eastern, passed the I-215, and right by the Las Vegas Athletic Club was the restaurant.  

When I walked in, mom had already been seated and luckily there was no line.  Last time we were here there was a twenty minute wait.  It's a somewhat small intimate restaurant with so many tables and chairs so close to one another.  So many people talking loudly, and plates clattering, sipping their soup loudly made me wonder if this is actually what it's like in a restaurant in Vietnam.  Looking forward to the day I find out through hands on experience.

No time was wasted and I gave my order of a #70.  I forgot the name but there was white noodles, some vegetables, herbs, barbecue shrimp, barbecue thinly sliced pork, and spring rolls.  The sauce on the side tasted like a sweet fish sauce with carrots and other ingredients to hide the gross smell of fish sauce.  I poured that in my bowl and mixed all the food around.  I haven't talked about fireworks in my mouth because it's been a while since I've felt that.  But, we're gonna talk about that in this review.

FIREWORKS!!!  When I put the food in my mouth, I literally felt like I was in the sky with fireworks around me.  I can still remember it like it was just a minute ago.  Normally, I don't like to eat past being full, but this dish was just too good to not finish.  The combination of the pork, noodles, vegetables, and sauce blended well together.  Food Network judges talks about texture a lot and this dish is not just mushy noodles and meat, but had the crunch of the vegetables and spring rolls.  The different texture was definitely there and worked very well with this dish.

Mom ordered something with seafood pho.  It was also very well made with crunchy garlic sprinkled on top.  Mom added vegetables and herbs to it which gave it a playful texture.  Her pho was also great.  All the food was awesome which is why I gave it a 4 stars.  

It's just too bad that the servers were far too busy to give any smile to the customers.  They're all so serious and don't look very friendly.  I'm sure they're very nice outside of work but while serving my mother and I, we didn't get that welcome feeling like they wanted us there.  Sure, they gave us water, took our order, brought out our food and finally our check.  That's all routine.  There was no *umph* to their service.  It was just eh and blah.

3 stars to the servers and 4 stars to the cooks.  I'm sure they were in a good mood to be cooking AWWWWWESOOMMMMMME!
This place is the bomb, we love their pho and fresh spring rolls.  If my kids eat their food, it must be good.

I have been obsessed with Pho Lately, and my best friend and his wife live just around the corner, so I thought we should try it. I like it. The vibe is nice( decorations were great), the food is yummy ( they even have small and large sizes for the pho!) and not pricey. It was about $10 each with a thai iced tea. I liked the fact that they had chopsticks and spoons in a little fancy dispenser on each table, along with the sauces. The waiter didn't really check on us, and we waited a few minutes to get the bill and a takeaway box, even with the usual "turning around to find someone to help us" look. So that's what keeps it from getting 5 stars, that's all. Enjoy!

Overall decent pho place, very flavorful broth with the lean steak/meatball pho. Quality of the meat was good and fresh accompaniments. One of the better pho options for the Henderson area. Service was decent, no complaints. Was just slightly disappointed when they got my to go order wrong when we were finished. 4/5

Lucky for me , it was a raining nite and I found a parking space in the small lot mentioned... Unaware of another Pho ,place across the street, I decided to pop into this one for dinner with my cousin??? I see this place along the freeway, when I am driving back and forth up hwy 215, it was crowded, but we got seated right away, the food was reasonably priced, the food tasty and the service was not bad.. They had a few item on the menu that we don't see at most of the Pho  places back home in the bay area.. I was not disappointed, but maybe I will go across the street , next time I am in town to try Lemongrass Cafe..

The food is good for the price but the service this time was not so good. We waited over 5 minutes just to get menus and I had to raise my voice for some one to notice me and another patron who was already eating handed me a menu before the restaurant handed us menus. I hope the next time I go back the service is better.

I have been going to Pho Saigon since last year. It's pretty close to where I live and only a walk away from LVAC.

I usually order the same thing -- a small bowl of their number 18 pho. Service is generally okay. I usually get my food about 10 minutes or less after putting in my order. I have tried their fresh spring rolls, they're not bad, though their sauce could use some improvement. They also do to-go orders, but I'm not sure about phone orders.

Ambiance is like your usual asian restaurant, although no matter how many times I have been there, I just can't recall whether they had music or not. It's also good for family, they can push tables together to accommodate a large party, and I think they have a different section for larger parties too.

I wish they had some kind of promo or discount for frequent customers. I'll be back again when my tummy craves for pho.

Completely tasteless broth... maybe it was water.

Go to Lemongrass down the street.

Very dissapointing.

This place is sooooo good, wooohooohooo from today forward this will be my neighborhood PHOvorite place to have my soup. It should be PHO you too. This PHOlace can be pack so plan your trip here, it can be very busy during lunch and dinner time but not bad you can be seated pretty fast. :)

This place is my go to when I'm trying to get soup or spring rolls real quick. I live pretty close by so that could be a factor, but the food I order is always good! If I'm craving pho, I know I'll always leave having satisfied the craving.

Note I said the food that I order because I don't really order anything else. I always get pho, spring rolls, or some type of vermicelli bowl. My usual options never disappoint so I keep sticking to them. If I'm getting pho, I always get #16 which has rare round eye, flank, and brisket. It is so yummy and satisfying!

I love the deep fried spring rolls. They might be called egg rolls, but I'm not actually sure. It comes with lettuce, mint, and pickled carrots and radish. I usually wrap one with lettuce and make a little burrito with the extra stuff and pour some of the sauce on top. You have got to try it! Sometimes that's all I'll order and I won't even share it.

It's a good restaurant, it's clean, and it's pretty cheap, especially for knowing your food will turn out right. Not everyone on the waiting staff speaks English very well. That never bothers me but I'm mentioning it in case some people need to prepare themselves for that. Be patient and understanding, and you shall have a delicious meal!

I really wish I could give them no stars.  People beware when eating here.  Always check your food for hair and always check your bill when you leave.  We ordered fried rice and found a hair in it.

My main disappointment with this place was how they overcharged me.  My total was $45 and some change.  I paid with a $100 bill and got back $44.  Tell me does that equal a Benjamin?  Yeah, tell me that y'all deserve an $11 tip is total BS.  Man I was ready to slap a bitch.  

So, I go back to the register and tell the older gentleman, I guess the owner, that the young guy that rung me up gave me the wrong change and showed him the change I received.  The older man was apologetic and corrected the error and said that they didn't mean to do it cause it was busy. But, when I went to pay it had already died down.  The young guy that rung me up didn't even apologize that he did wrong and fkd up even as the owner tried getting his attention.  

If y'all are wondering if I left them a tip, the answer is HELL to the NO, would any of you after that stunt?  I simply just smiled and walked out.  

Since y'all hungry for tip here's one: teach your employees to calculate your customers' bills correctly.   Basic arithmetic isn't really that hard, you can learn from YouTube and I ain't got time for y'all's . To say the least I will no longer be requiring your services.  Bye Felicia.

The first time I came in we were seated immediately and got our waters within minutes of sitting. However, it did take a long time for someone to come and take our orders. There were two other parties that were sat after us and their order was taken and delivered before us. That part annoyed me because whenever we would call someone they would say "I'll be right with you to take your order" but we proceed to watch them taking orders from parties who came after us.  

Anyways, the food is really good! I ordered the #70 Vermicelli bowl with pork, shrimp, and spring rolls. Their sauce for the vermicelli was delicious! I have never tasted a good vermicelli before from other restaurants so for that it'll be my go-to place. Their green onion portioning are really small so it isn't as big/ regular sized as it is at other places. They took a while to refill my water during my last couple of visits so be aware that you will have to flag down your severer a couple of times. You would have to ask for the chili garlic sauce because they don't put it out on the table with the siriacha and hoisin. My fiancè's plate and mine came out to $23 with tax, not including tip. I like their vermicelli Bowl but their service are slow when they're busy.

Over all, the foods are good and in large portions. Prices are reasonable. The place is almost full most of the time, but we always get seated right away. Services are not exceptional, but just enough to get good experience.
I travel from city to city and eat Pho all of the country. This was pretty good of the 40 to 50 restaurants I've eaten in this is a top five.

This place is great for a quick lunch or dinner. The food here is always delicious and always hits the spot.

What doesn't is their service. Usually the waitresses are rushing you, rolling their eyes, and just have an attitude. It's like they don't want to be there. Sometimes I question if it's the language barrier or not, but I don't think that's the case here.

Wanna talk about asian soul food? Try the beef stew at Pho Saigon 8. OMG its soo thick, rich, and hearty. It comes served with either french bread, rice, and noodles but my bf and i will always order all three LOL. its way too good to even waste a single drop. 

Okay enough with the obsessiveness. I have been to many pho shops in las vegas, little saigon, pho kim long, pho so 1 and it seems like the beef stew always comes out as beef soup. Its flavorless, oily, and watery. At pho saigon 8, you can tell the broth gets its richness from the cubes of beef and tendon and the sweetness from the onions and the carrots boiling for many hours. Since this location has opened, either one of us always orders this dish. But as usual the pho-, bun-, and the plate dishes are exceptional. The only reason why I give this place 4 and not 5 stars is because of the customer service, the waitress sat us at a dirty and sticky table and the server next came to refill our water. If you look at a typical asian family,  it seems like we care mainly about the taste/ quality of food only and less the customer service aspect. We have this 'dont bother me, dont check on me unless if i ask' kinda thing. But wiping down tables, and refilling water should be a must!
Great motha phoken pho yo ! Eat here for some great pho and sexy paintings of Asian women. I wish I can take out me some pho too!
So sad to say but unfortunately, I will no longer eat here...they were featured on dirty dining and had a bunch of demerits. That must explain the stomachache I had the last time I ate there??
I've been here several times. The staff is always friendly and your food is delivered in minutes. Great go to spot for a quick meal that hits the spot.

I ordered a chicken rice noodle dish and there was barely any chicken.  It was all
Noodles and the chicken was dry with no flavor.  They used to be a lot better.  I still think I like the pho but that's about it.

Comfortable spot for some quick pho.

Environment: The inside of the restaurant isn't anything special, but it is cozy. Seating is done quickly, which is most important when grabbing a quick lunch. The only thing I would say is that when we went there, there had been no music or anything playing which did make the environment a little change. It wasn't awkwardly quiet because the sound of all the customers talking to one another at their respective tables filled the air, however some type of music playing could have been welcomed.

Food: To start we got spring rolls, which were nice and fresh just how I like them. Dipping sauce was good as well. As for the pho, they had a nice sized menu with numerous options. I like the ones with a couple different varieties of meat in it so I could get one which combined flank, rare beef, and tendon. The bowl was huge and the flavor was good. Probably was not the best pho I have ever had but it can compare to other pho spots in Vegas.

Service: Service was quick and efficient which is what I would expect. Never felt like I was waiting for anything or that it was hard to get anyone's attention so I would say that I was satisfied.

Overall I would come here again if I were in the mood for noodles and in the area (especially since Monta closed, and Henderson has a lack of noodle spots in general), however I doubt I wouldn't put it up there with my real favorite pho restaurants which I would be willing to drive farther for.

I don't know if this was good because I was hungover af when I came in, but this was thee best pho I have ever had.

The broth though. How can I describe the flavor...it wasn't salty nor was it too sweet, but it packed a hell of a flavor. And the beef...omfg. Shit was tender and juicy. Not overcooked and dry like some pho restaurants.

Yeah...I def killed my small bowl #22. They messed up my order and gave me the wrong bowl at first (which led me to be the last to get food out of all my friends) but I'll let that slide because this pho was just so damn good.

We came on a Sunday evening and ordered
1. #12 Pho tai chin, 8.05 Large 
2. #60 Com ga roti, 8.05 
for $20

- Conveniently located right off the 215. 
- Legit Viet restaurant! Cramped seating. Waiter speaks Viet to take our order. Grandma serves us our meal. Pay at the cashier after you finish eating. The only thing missing is a sign that says cash only! haha! Love it! 
- Pho tai chin: noodle soup with rare eye round steak and well done lean meat
Steaming hot when served. Broth was good, but average. I liked how the well done meat didn't have a lot of fat on it. Need more bean sprouts and cilantro. 
- Com ga roti: roasted Cornish hen, served with French rice or steamed rice, 8.05
Delicious French rice. They made it crispy and dry enough where you can still taste the tomato paste and not soggy. The chicken was a bit burnt and quite small. They did give plenty of vegetable sides and broth side soup was a good compliment. Seems like the side soup is what they would use for their wanton soup. 
- Viets eat here so you know its good.
- It takes hours to make the broth of pho bc you have to cook the bone. Just because its fast, doesn't mean its old. It's marinated. 
- Prices are cheaper than others in Henderson. I think this place gets mixed reviews since it's Henderson and expect American style service. 
- Similar to Spring Mountain

I enjoy spring rolls and a bowl of pho every now and then. When I have the appetite for Vietnamese food, I just have to have it. The boyfriend phoned in a to-go order for me. We were told the food will be ready in 15 minutes. When we got there, we still had to wait.

Pho Tai: 
Nothing exciting to write home about. It was ordinary and slighly saltier than normal. 2/5

Spring Rolls:
Teeny tiny rolls and they skimp on meat/shrimp. The peanut sauce is quite salty. 1/5

Thai Iced Tea: 
Not the best place to get this from. It has a weird flavor and texture. 2/5

There are other Vietnamese restaurants along Eastern Avenue. I'd recommend going somewhere else.

Fast service, always fresh food. Great value. I have a preference for the #15 Pho Tai Bo Vien. Noodle soup with rare eye round steak and beef meatballs. Not a salty broth like some Phos sometimes come.

random viet restaurant in a strip mall - didnt even know it existed as you really can't see it from the street. they have a wide range of vietnamese food, including diff sizes for pho. one of the few places that have the tomato based crab and pork meat noodles - which came with 3 huuge blocks of blood cubes. not a fan of those but luckily was able to pick those out. 

overall, decent place for cravings.

Definitely one of my favorite Vietnamese places in Vegas. My regular order is #73, Bun Bo Hue. It is a thicker version of rice noodle in spicy soup. It comes with pork blood, tendon, pig feet and tripes; which is more texture than just the sliced meat or meatballs alone. Nice service and menu selections, great for casual dining.

My go to for Pho ! Great quality food + nice & fresh ! Best broth in my opinion.
No AC last time I was there & it was unbearably hot inside. Table next to took food to go. That may have been a temporary thing I hope...

Before I was introduced to pho-milan.  I would always go here especially since it was right next to LVAC and I would usually come here for a quick bite to eat after the gym or craving for some vietnamese food.  

The food was just okay nothing amazing.  
Spring Rolls: It is usually a hit & miss thing. Sometimes its tasteful and sometimes is very bland.  When its bland I would have to use a lot of the dipping sauce to have some taste to the spring rolls.

Pho: I normally dont order pho, but when I finally did, I hated it.  I forgot what I ordered but it was not great at all.  It was cold and I asked them to reheat it, but one of the servers didnt understand what I was asking.  They had to ask another server to figure out what I wanted.  But after they reheated it, it wasnt something I would order again. 

Pork&Rice: I usually order this and in order for me to enjoy it. I would always use the pho's broth that they bring on the side and I would add it to the meat and rice to have more flavor to it.  

Service:  They normally dont smile when you enter their restaurant and only one or two of them is friendly.  I would have to flag them down to re-fill my glass of water and ask for the check.

So this was the first time I've bought here, there's one in Texas that we love  so far the food we got was pretty good I must say but the only thing we didn't quite like were the spring rolls, they should use Roman lettuce for them or a better lettuce vs the iceberg lettuce. We will go back to them and try other dishes!!

I may not be the biggest Vietnamese food fan.  The food was just ok.  
Ambiance, eh, service and overall, just ok.

Food here is really good dont get me wrong my family and i come here often . But this one time we order to go the lady at the regester is so dam rude on the phone . When i got there she was still rude i wanted to tell her off so bad i will be going to pho king up the road from now on this is what that scum look like !!

This used to be our go to spot for pho, especially when the whole family is in town, but we took about a yearlong hiatus after we had a couple of bad experiences with service and decided to head down the street for our Vietnamese. We came back recently and the food was good and the service was better because we went during a non peak time. It will usually be busy when you go in, and because of this, service can be inattentive. Generally, your server will also be curt with you, that's the way they always have been and I don't see that changing anytime soon.

The pho here is consistently good. Everyone in my family, except for a select few, always order pho. I usually get #16 (I am not going to remotely attempt to spell any of the dishes) which is rare eye round, flank, and brisket. They'll bring you as much of the accouterments needed for your soup also. Even though it doesn't take them long to bring out your bowl once you order, you can tell the broth has been cooking for hours. The deep beef flavor is easily detectable along with the aroma of spices like star anise and clove. A big squeeze of sriracha for heat is the only other thing that I usually add to my soup.

I have had a few of their rice plates and they are satisfactory. The kids will always want an order of shredded pork spring rolls to start and they usually don't last too long. Pricing is affordable, usually right around $$ per person depending how many large bowls and sodas are ordered. Heads up also, check your bill before you pay because they'll tack on 15% gratuity for your party (it may be posted on a small sign in the front) and not say a word when they give you the check or after you've signed off on an extra 20% tip. Ultimately it's our fault for not looking over the check, but you're welcome Pho Saigon 8.

The pho is good enough to keep us coming back occasionally, but not good enough to overcome the service to make us regular visitors.

Usually I LOVE this place. Me and my boyfriend go here all the time for the yummy pho but my most recent trip here was sO ANNOYING. First we called ahead to take our food to go and they told us it would be ready in 10 minutes. Okay so to kill time we went to yogurt land (which is next door) and made our way to the restaurant and our food still wasn't ready. We we're told to sit and wait at the tables by the bathroom, so we did. Ten minutes later some customers come in and THEY KICK US OUT of the booth! There were other tables to seat them why they gotta kick us out and our food still wasn't done. We wait another ten minutes and I decide to tell them wassup like why am I waiting 30 minutes for them to give me some broth and noodles in some styrofoam? We didn't order anything fancy just the regular noodles and broth smh.

People rave about this place. After having tried a Ramen place the night before in China Town, I thought this place was just OK, at best.

Service was very slow, they squashed us in a side table even though there were plenty of other seats, and didn't really explain WTF we were supposed to be doing.  For instance, I guess you are supposed to be wrapping the egg rolls in the large pieces of lettuce they give you??? They give you a BUNCH of stuff to doctor up your soup with, which I guess should've been my first indication that it wasn't going to be all that good.

DON'T GET THE MEATBALLS. They were nasty. Apparently, there's some confusion on meatballs and sausage in a casing?  You literally had to bite and tear into these packets of meat to get a chunk off of them. It definitely reminded me of eating an overcooked piece of sausage and way too big to be eating in one bite.

The Thai Tea was amazing but I felt for it's size, extremely over priced. In fact, the whole thing was a bit overpriced, it was almost $40 for 3 of us for lunch without tip.
Trying to get the check was a production too, then paying the check up at the front, then tipping was all very strange.

I think we all agreed we don't have to go back.

As a regular pho eater, I can say that pho is good here. (I am half Vietnamese and my mom is terrible at making pho so I often go out to eat it.)

The noodles are a hit or miss and since I'm a big noodle eater, this matters to me. Sometimes they are soggy but sometimes they are perfect. Though the broth is consistent and is one of the best in Vegas, making this place one of the few solid pho places around Vegas. 

It is still not up to par with LA pho places, but as I have said in other reviews I have yet to eat at a pho place in Vegas that measures up.

The only thing that is below average, even for an asian restaurant (which says a lot), is the service. 

I am used the okay service of asian restaurants where the waitresses are often overwhelmed with too many customers and often forget things and don't have enough time to give you a lot of time, so that doesn't bother me. What does bother me is when a worker is walking around like he has nothing and they purposely ignores you. I ordered a pho from one guy working there and never ended up getting my order. He even avoided me and purposely ignored me when I tried to catch his attention . Finally another server saw me and promptly got my order, at least she was very nice. I wish I could say that this only happened to me once (and I would be willing to overlook it since I come here often) but it was not the only time and he was not the only guy that did that.

HORRIBLE service. The only reason I gave two stars was because the food was pretty darn great. I had dinner here with my mom and the whole time the waitress and waiter (we were served by both) had an attitude and were rushing us. The waiter asked for our order as soon as they handed us the menu and we asked for a few minutes. He came back two minutes later and asked for our order and again we asked for a few more minutes because there's like a thousand items on the menu and it was my first time there. We finally ordered and the waitress came out and brought our food since our waiter was on his break having his meal at the table in front us us. We had the pho ga, shrimp spring rolls, and shrimp fried rice. Everything was absolutely delicious! When we asked the waitress for another order of shrimp spring rolls, she brought them back to us in a to-go box. I guess she wanted us to leave so we left since we were done with their crap. This place really needs to work on their customer service. The entire time both waiters had an attitude and a mad look on their face. I am a very polite customer and great tipper everywhere I go but I didn't leave a damn thing here. I'm never going back there again.

Haven't had Pho in months.  The Pho restaurant by our home in Arkansas just vanished one day.  No Pho restaurants within 100 miles.

Saigon 8 is near a townhouse I'm renting.  It was excellent.  The sliced Brisket was very tender and the sirloin was sliced to perfection and very flavorful.  Lots of bean sprouts, basil, onion, etc to dress it up.

Service was very fast and the people behind the counter were very nice as well.  Wish I lived closer

Fast and yummy...granted I usually just get the Pho, but I love it.  I can add as much or as little veggies and sauce as I want.  
I go there ALOT (coffee is sooooooo good).
I just love it!

Gosh... today I'm sick as hell and we came here for pho, tea and egg rolls. We come here all the time. I ask for Thai tea and it comes back half full. Then I send it back and she brings it back with no ice, half full. Why can't you full the fuxking cup up the right way if you want me to pay full price?! We come here allllll the time!!!!!! Irritating and poor service today

Incredibly flavorful, tasty broth, with generous portions of meat (got the #21). I also got the vermicelli bowl (combo with fried egg roll, pork) and it was awesome. Generous portions that it serves as two meals for me. I've had the vermicelli bowl at Mai Lang (another Viet place in Henderson) and pho Saigon 8 is much better. 

Service: Its fast but don't expect too much from it, it's really bare bones (take your order, refill your water, that's about it). They're not rude by any means though, just business.

Okay, this place is a little hated on, but I think it's a pretty good option if you are on this side of town.  The Bun Bo Hue is not the best I've had, but definitely is one that has the most meat/pork cake/pork hock, etc inside.  It could be a little spicier, but I don't think the broth is half bad.  The grilled chicken/egg roll vermicelli bowl is pretty tasty as well, the chicken is very tender and flavorful.  There are negatives to this place, it's kind of dirty and the service is pretty bad.  Also, I've only been there a few times but definitely some inconsistencies in the dish.  One time the vermicelli bowl came without any greens....and one time I just got the regular bean sprouts when usually it's a different dish for the bun bo hue.  So not the best, but not bad for being in this area.

Food is fine. Bun bo is spicy but great.Clean and fast service. I found this place it is very convenient and affordable to have lunch or dinner in Vegas. I tried some chicken but it was not as good as I expected since it was a little dry. Bun cha is ok. Nothing special.

I got takeout here so I can't comment on the service,which probably is ok. 
It is located in a small strip mall and appears clean and have some typical Asian decorations. Obligatory buddha some water structure. 
The food however was a huge disappointment. I didnt have the pho so maybe I'm unfairly judging but the spring rolls had lettuce that you buy at the grocery store, rice noodles, and some tofu. That's it! Where's the cilantro? Wheres the sliced carrots? The noodle with dish with chicken was very tasteless and frankly just bad. If someone ate here believing they were eating vietnamese food they might say they hate an entire country's food without a proper reference point. 

Maybe the pho is better but based on the quality of the other stuff I dont expect it.

Food is always good here! I noticed they did a lot of changes. New menus and appetizer are much bigger now than before. Service is always ehh. It's ALWAYS a hit a miss. You would have to raise your hand or make eye contact with the servers/bussers to get what you need. I only come here because it's closer to me. But, if I were to choose where to eat I would say Pho Mailan is so much better! It's better making the trip to go further down on eastern for amazing food and service!
friendly and attentive wait staff. food was pretty good and authentic, good location, i don't have to drive all the way to China town to eat, so it's a plus for me!

We've been looking for a yummy Pho for a while and Yelp helped us find Pho Saigon 8!!  

I ordered a Tofu vegetable Pho while the boyfriend ordered Chicken Pho and Spring Rolls. (bill came out to $20 and change)  DE-LICIOUS!  Eric said his chicken was moist (not the usual overcooked and dry) broth was a perfect, steaming hot- but NOT burn your mouth hot.  

...Talk about FAST food, the spring rolls came out minutes after we ordered it and our Pho came out as Eric was finishing up his appetizer (and he eats fast!)

it's a smaller restaurant and was packed at 5pm (it's a good sign that the food was going to be good!).  The decor is nice, table tops are some kind of stone/granite (no booths) and it was clean.  I'm agreeing with another reviewer, it's a tight fit and the tables are a little close together and I don't recall any type of music playing.  The service was friendly, nice and quick- although there was not much rapport between us.  They were great about busing the tables and keeping it clutter-free (my pet peeve).  Must agree with another reviewer, the parking lot is a little small...   Despite the semi-negative description of the restaurant itself, don't let that stop you from eating the YUMMY food!!

I overheard customer at another table complementing the server for the GREAT food he just had.  He introduced himself to the server and told him he would be a frequent customer.. :o) = so I know I wasn't the only one Raving about how good the food was!!!

5 stars for delicious food at a great price, nice sized servings (was a bonus) and quick and friendly service.  This will be a restaurant that we re-visit a few times a month- I know it!

YUM! This is by far our favorite Vietnamese / Pho restaurant in town! The service can be spotty but the food is always consistent and great! Plus, you cannot beat the prices. Both of us eat usually for under $20 even with an appetizer!

Our favorites

Crunchy Egg Rolls $5.95
Meatball / Beef Pho small $6.75
Sliced pork and grilled shrimp with virmecelli $6.75
Thai Iced Tea $2.25

This is a new location so it is pretty nice inside. It does, however, get pretty busy around meal times so plan ahead and come a little early to get a good table. 

You won't be disappointed - that's Pho sure!

boy is it cold out in vegas tonight.. stopped in here with the parentals to get warm and toasty..
i rarely eat anything else than seafood pho.. so tonight i got the small #44 which only consists or shrimp and crab! the other place i usually eat pho at in the bay area has more seafood items in the meal but since those are my top 2 favorite things.. it sounded like the perfect bowl!
my choice of beverage tonight was their fresh squeezed lemonade! 
food came out in a timely manner.. and everything looked delish..
i loved how i ordered a small but they gave me noodles as it was a large! i was totally expecting imitation crab.. and to my surprise there was real crab meat.. couldn't get better than that! shrimp was kinda bland but nothing that sriracha sauce can't fix!
taste, size, temperature of the whole thing was wonderful.. just what i needed for a cold night!
my lemonade was bomb! i usually don't care for tart sour drinks but i must say this was some good as lemonada! so refreshing to the mouth after a hot meal!
i shall come here many more times in the future! 

oh the bad.. 
not so many parking spaces for the little shoppping area its in.. seating arrangements kinda suck.. service was ok.. but they could try to come around a little more often.. and when the bill came back swiped and all.. they didn't have a customer copy receipt.. only store copy.. i personally don't care for that extra piece of paper but many do!

oh did i mention there's a yogurtland next door.. :)

All i can say was DELICIOUS! i came in for lunch today with my parents 'cuz we were hungry for some viet food and it was perfect for a chilly noon time. I ordered the beef stew with french bread, crepe and egg roll for appetizer. They prolly have the best crepe and beef stew in town! And ooooohh goodnesssss the french bread was perfect!!!! It was hot, crunchy, and fluffy! From the first bite, it made me say "daammn" hahaha.. yes it is that delicious!! Also the crepe was perfectly cooked and very decent filling! I was really glad that it was not OILY! unlike the one at pho kim long it was soaking in oil (totally disgusting) but anyways the service was nice too! Fast and on point! 

So if you're looking for an authentic viet food in henderson this is a must go to place! And they also have another location at spring mtn. 

MUST TRY: beef stew with french bread/rice/noodles, crepe, and their viet hot coffee was delicious!

I am not too picky with pho, HOWEVER, this place soup base tasted really really salty! MSG??? and BIGGEST let down was their MEATBALL tasted like RUBBER! never ever did I encounter that in ANY of pho restaurants I've been to. Their price is higher than other pho restaurants, and the servers took very long to take order, and didn't seem to know what they were doing. Like if you see an empty water cup pushed to side of the table...of course....you want more water! spring roll was bland and very bad! will not go back!

Love Pho! Have only had it a few times. Small bowl was plenty and the taste was amazing! Shrimp spring roll was cold and dipping sauce delicious. Right off freeway so will be an easy stop again. Most customers were Vietnamese, so you know all the food is good. Waiter recommended the type of Pho we had. Delicious!!!

I've eaten here like 3 times already since i've moved from California. Living in cities like SD, LA, and the SF Bay Area where I would constantly find myself eating at Pho spots over a million times, I was a bit scared to see what Vegas would provide for my Pho cravings.

So far I've stumbled upon this place and the Pho is ok. The broth has the usual flavor, but I think I've had more flavorful broths eating in spots like Pho Ca Dao in San Diego and Jasmin Garden in San Francisco. But I will say the large bowl of Pho can hit the spot when you have the craving.

I have also had their wonton egg noodle soup. Pretty basic. Noodles have a soft texture and the wontons break a part easily--making it a pleasant experience eating together. I'm sad they didn't have the spicy chili oil sauce they have in some Vietnamese/Chinese spots.

Their fresh spring rolls are good as well.

In a way, I think their food is a tad bit over priced compared to some mom and pop Vietnamese restaurants I love going to in California, but ehh i'll get over it. 

Another thing is that they have a limit of $10 when using credit cards. Since sometimes I usual eat by myself for dinner, it's kind of annoying.

So overall, the place is just OK in my book.

This place is addictive. Never seen it empty and the most iv had to wait is a couple minutes. Service is really fast and out of the dozen times iv been here they've always gotten my order correct. 
  As far as the food I usually get the #16 pho and maybe some spring rolls or egg rolls. Both are amazing! Best pho around by far. And also the house hot tea is a mixed blend and awesome. 
   I definitely recommend this place. You will be hooked

I give this place a 5 star for its food!! Its service is a 3.5 on average lol

We first came to this spot since it was so close to home. It really kick started our pho love. We have tried other places and have now decided this is our spot!!! The broth is amazingly flavored. They give generous portions so if your not a big eater the small would fill you up. 

Our meals consist of #13 beef broth with raw rib eye and flank, with a side of broccoli... Get it raw the broth is so hot that it will cook thw rib eye to perfection. #18 raw rib eye, flank, tendon, and tripe. We also start with #1 crispy egg rolls that come with generous lettuce and mint. Overall this place has the best Pho in Henderson!! No joke! 

The service is spotty. However, we are willing to deal with it for the quality and freshness of the food. It is best to order everything you need before your server leaves to enter your order. Also, if you need a refill on your drink move your cup in eyes view they are ninjas when it comes to refills. We have never had a server be rude they are just usually pretty busy and they are there to get things done. It is very clean and it is not a place to lounge. 

If you live in henderson and you are in need of some dank Pho this is a must try!!!

I've been eating at Vietnamese Pho restaurants my whole life. Coming from LA, I tend to be a Pho snob but this place is soooo good. I got the one with everything rare. The soup is clean but full of flavor and the large bowl is PACKED with ingredients. Exactly what I'm looking for before a long ride back to LA and decently priced!

So I had pho once in my life, it was seafood, I didn't like it and that was back in California. I, in my never ending quest to "try new things" went out for Vietnamese with my sister after coming up empty at Whole Foods. 

I've passed by this place a million times and have wanted to try it. Again, even if I don't like something the first time, I try to try it in a different preparation again at another time. We walked inside, it was nice, clean, and we were seated promptly. My sister decided she wasn't hungry and didn't want to try anything so she ordered a side of rice. I ordered a #73 (I have no idea what the real name was.) The description said it was spicy. The waitress told me it had pig's blood in it. Was I a little hesitant, yeah, but I ordered it anyway.

My sister's rice was delivered to our table in about 2 seconds, along with the mint and lettuce for my pho. About 5 minutes later, the soup came out. I was completely unfamiliar with the two gray black cubes of ??? and the white pate like half circle floating on the side. Apparently, according to the waitress, it was pig's blood sausage and another type of sausage. I had to skip the blood sausage. I couldn't bring myself to try it. The pork in it, well, I couldn't identify what part of the animal it was from. The fat was very rare. 

Was the soup spicy? No. I had to add a ton of siracha to my soup, along with the jalapenos. Would I go there again? Maybe, but I would for sure try something else. What I ordered was not something that had a lot of depth of flavor.

I only go here with my g/f when she is craving a beef noodle bowl. The service here is poor. Staff members never check up on us or refill our beverages after we've been served. Last time we were here, some of the staff were horseplaying right in front of the customers. The restaurant is very dirty too. I once sat down and shuffled my chair forward and my hand was covered in something slimy. Its disgusting smell forced me to head to the restroom and wash my hands repeatedly. I will take the advice of other reviewers and try out Lemongrass nearby.

This is a traditional Vietnamese restaurant where you'll need to seat yourself and pay at the register, so don't write a crappy review about waiting for your check or sitting at a dirty table. The food here is always fresh and consistently delicious. I suggest you try the crispy egg noodle plate along with a sweet iced coffee.
Service is excellent, every time i come and eat with my fambam Lucy knows my order like usual !! Great people and very friendly !!

The pho is delicious, the place is causal and low key. ...The service, not so much. I waited at a table for a few mins, and one server kept avoiding eye contact. After I got my order, no one checked to see if I needed anything. And my dirty plates were not bussed and remained on the table until I left. Service 2.5 stars. Food 4 stars.

I go here all the time because:

1. It's always busy, that means food is good.

2. The bean sprouts and basil in the side are always fresh. The ingredients are fresh. Order something beside pho and taste the fresh ingredients. They don't have to put too much seasoning. "FRESH!"

3. They have the pickled jalapeño jar. I'm Thai, we Thais need something other than siracha. I only wish they had fresh ground chili. 

4. Service is simple, they just take order and you get up and pay at counter, I like that. So the food is not expensive and one does not need to leave a huge tip. 

I love this place. I seriously do. I just wish they had sandwiches too. Then my life would be complete.

The food is inexpensive and very tasty.  The service can be up or down depending on whatever I have had good service when it was busy and bad service when it was quiet(example we were escorted to a table when the restaurant was quiet, my wife asked to be seated at a different table, the host said it was dirty and left our water and menus at the table which we did not want to be seated and left.  We then waited for the table to be cleaned and then transferred our own water and menu.   I put up with the service because this is still my go to place for pho.   Except for one time when they placed our order to a different table by mistake our orders are usually served without a long wait.  If not for the spotty service I would give 4 stars.  Usually however they keep your water glass full(except once)

I have come here a few times. More so on my lunch break. 
They prepare  everything fresh, it was always hot when I came to pick it up.

 I have tried the spring rolls. Very good. Fresh shrimp, good peanut sauce.
Also I have tired the egg rolls,they are the small ones minimally filled but have an great inside! I like how with the order you get a big bag of lettuce and things. The sauce for the rolls is also very good.

I should have tried more and gone more often, maybe I will. 
But from what I did have , it was always good!

Overall: Pho Saigon 8 disappoints in making its namesake dish, but the Hu Tieu was pretty dang good. It might be my regular for that dish, but I'll have to continue looking for a pho restaurant.

Food: 3

Pho Chin (Cooked Brisket): The broth lacked the intense umaminess from beef bones, but it was clear and not too sweet. However, the brisket was completely dry and tasteless.

Hu Tieu My Tho Kho: Surprisingly, this dish was good. The sauce was well balanced and flavorful. There was plenty of sautéed ground pork and offals, and the shrimps were a good size. They aren't too consistent on the offals as one bowl had almost all heart while the other had a mix of heart and liver. Make sure to ask for the hu tieu giay!

Service: 3

We didn't have too many interactions with the waiters outside of ordering and asking for a few extra things.

As a California native from Little Saigon, I'm used to ordering in Vietnamese in Vietnamese restaurants. However, I'm not sure if all the waiters here speak Vietnamese fluently because our waiter seemed to have a hard time understanding my order.

Ambiance: 4

Pho Saigon 8 is a small restaurant, so the tables are kind of close together. But it's decently clean and cool.

Came here for lunch the other day since I was on this side of town. I came with a bunch of friends and we got seated immediately. 

I ordered a small pho with brisket & beef balls. My friends got a large pho (#18) & egg rolls. We got our rolls first and without really looking at the menu we assumed that spring rolls were the fried rolls, since a lot of Vietnamese places call spring rolls egg rolls & the uncooked rolls summer rolls. But I guess every Vietnamese place differs? (Kinda confusing tho :( ) we told them that we wanted the fried ones so they had to go back & make our order. At first they told us to just take it & eat them since we ordered it but why take something we won't eat right? The pho on the other hand was good. It had a lot of green onions which I personally like & the broth was flavorful. But my friends & I felt like the only difference with the large was more soup and a bit more meat. They didn't have a lot of noodles to accommodate the meat and I usually like that. My pho had a lot of noodles but not enough meat. I had about 4 beef balls cut in half (2 full size beef balls) & 4 pieces of brisket. I was left with a lot of noodles leftover. Pho 8/10 The egg rolls was good tho! 10/10

Customer service was decent. I feel like at a lot of Asian places customer service is just whatever. Not the friendliest but also not the meanest. A guy always came to refilled our water so +1 for them! 

Overall, will come back here again to eat their pho! Especially because of th broth & how fast it was to receive your order.

I know what I am getting every time I go.  I used to frequent the Spring Mountain location for like 10 years.  This one is much more convenient off the 215.  I even go alone if I am in the mood for Pho!

I have a resolution to everyone's service complaints!! Order to go!

I placed an order for pickup after work... I've never done this with pho before, so when I went to pick up my ONE order of #11, pho tai, I was surprised to look like I ordered for an entire family! 

I got home, unwrapped my goods.... it was just like I was at the restaurant, in my own home:]. Everything that they would serve you was included: all the leafy goodness (still not sure what all of it is), cilantro and chives, LOTS of noodles, and a generous amount of  RAW thin slices of beef. This was all neatly organized in a generic Styrofoam to-go box.  Hoisin sauce and red pepper sauce were also packed into my belongings. Also, a large Styrofoam cup/bowl(?) of the beef broth. The broth was still piping hot. It cooked my beef slices just as I wanted, instantly. Although I did make the mistake of keeping the lid off, so it cooled down pretty quickly and didn't cook the beef so well for my second portion. 

Absolutely delicious. 

I prepared it all just how I would want it.. and even came back for seconds. I of course didn't waste all the meat, but I couldn't finish the noodles. 

It seems that people really knock the ratings down on this place because of the service... so may I recommend take out?? Try it again yallllll
Yummy Pho for dinner is always yummy and healthy, no meat just noodle and soup with lots off green onions

From the moment we walked in, we were told to seat ourselves at a table that was still dirty. The person that cleaned it didn't do such a hot job and never stocked the soup spoons or chopsticks. When we were seated the waitress came and took our order and within 5 minutes we had our pho. The pho was delicious, I can't complain about that but the service was awful. No one came to check on us throughout our meal, no one came to fill up our drinks or even give us napkins. We had to wait about 20 minutes to get someone's attention, when the guy came over I asked for two to-go containers and the check, the guy said ok and disappeared. Just to see him helping others and ignoring us....it was an additional 20 minutes until the waitress who helped us in the beginning came back and checked on us!!! Seriously!? She asked if we wanted water and if we were okay, an hour after she took our order...it's not a big place, it was a normal busy but come on! It's sad cause the food was good but customer service goes a long way.

Great, lunch or dinner. Comfortable room with minimal decor or distractions.  Rarely full so easy to bring families or groups without advance planning; it seems people don't know about the great food here. Lunch specials until 2pm and great selections on the menu. Best meal for the value.

I have been going to this restaurant for quite a while and the soup is good. I find that sometimes the waiters are jerks ... And they are not honest or they don't understand you! I ordered a small bowl of soup today and got a small soup ... I have been going there long enough to tell the difference (even though sometimes it is hard to tell). When I walked up to the register the guy charged me for a large one ... After arguing with him as to what I ordered and what I got, he took two steps to the side checked my table and said yeah that's a big one ... I walked back there and took a big one from another table and put it next to it, he still charged me for a big one. It is a dollar, I don't want to argue with stupid people but I won't go there again. Way to go playing with a customer that was there at least once a week ! Finding another place right now ...

this place is mediocre at best, nothing surpasses the Pho in "little Saigon."

I had the Tai, Nam, Gan small bowl (same thing I get everywhere) &&had only about 2 pieces of each type of meat in my bowl. 

We also ordered BBQ Pork Chops to go to eat with vermicelli at home, but word to the wise, DO NOT order it separately, you might as well get it with rice there for the extra 2bucks, since it came out to about $5/piece.

Sooooooo good. I love this place. The pho is seriously the best. Please give this place a try. The lemon grass beef is awesome (#56). Just eat it.
Onto the pho...... if you've come here and reviewed it as "not tasty" or "tasteless" then come on back and throw some sriracha in your soup. It's not needed though. The soup is fantastic. 
If you want some damn good Vietnamese food, this is the place. 
One last thing.... ALWAYS tip your server. Please. 
Understand that you're walking into a restaurant that serves food from a different culture. 
Enjoy!!

I used to enjoy coming here, but today after I ate a couple pieces of my chicken from my dark meat chicken pho,and I told the waitress the soup was very salty, can I cxl it if it's possible, and she said"your ordered it and you already eat it, can't cxl it" really??????
